column5: Over the years, I've tried maybe 6 Blu phones. All of them looked amazing, but we laggy to the point it drove me nuts and if take them back. I just got the Vivo XL2 and I'm absolutely happy with this phone. It's freaking stylish as usual, but it has tons of bells and whistles like a more expensive phone, and so far it works amazingly  well. I can't believe how nice this phone is for the price. Unreal. And ignore the 64 gig SD card limitation. It took my 128 gig no problem at all. LOVE MY NEW PHONE!!!  If Blu keeps this up, I'll keep buying Blu.I've had it for a week now and I still love it. It only got better. I failed to mention that this has quick charge, and comes with a case and arrives with a screen protector on the phone, with no bubbles or junk under the film. It also comes with an extra screen protector. I can't say how much I love this phone for the price paid. So happy with it.

People love to get a new phone and,  while riding that new tech high, get on Amazon and shout "BEST PHONE EVER"  when obviously it's not.  Here is my open honest list view of the Pros and Cons of this phone.Pros:Price: Even at the suggested retail of 149 usd, this phone out performs the price tagBuild quality: Built like a 700 usd flagship device. Manages to look both beautiful & professionalCall quality :  Perfect, which means it does what a phone is supposed to doScreen: at 720p its NOT as nice as an iPhone or Pixel, but it does look amazing on the 5.5 inch screenAntenna: Most forgotten feature of reviews... This phone has service in the basement of the hospital I work at, on both on Tmobile AND AT&T.  Having duel Sims,  I decided to put in both my personal and work sim cards in the phone. The Sony Xperia M5 Ultra I had before this got zero service for most parts of the basement.  This Vivo XL2 has at least 2 bars of 4g lte service through out the entire basement. Same sim cards, same Radio bands supported, and yet only this phone gets signal.Sound: loud and crisp, even with a back firing speaker.  I'd prefer a front facing speaker,  but oh well.Camera, both front and back:  Great cameras for 149 usd.... AVERAGE Camera for 700 usd.  So comparing the pictures to your iPhone or Galaxy s6 or Pixel pictures your gonna be disappointed most of the time. However, snap a pic in good lighting, share it to Facebook or Instagram, and you would be surprised how nice they look.Battery:  true 5 and 1/2 hours of screen-on time which is absolutely amazing.  However, though they claim its quick charging, it's really not.  2 hours to fully charge from 25% isn't standard quick charge, it's actually "not slow" charging at best.. LoLAnd finally IR blaster.  Not many phones have it anymore, but it's nice to be able to mess with the TVs at the hospital.  It's entertaining changing  the channel from Fox News to MSNBC, or vice versa, just to watch the brainwashed receptionists mind explode when someone actually disagrees with their world view.CONS:Skin/software:  Though its running Android 6.01 you'd be hard pressed to notice. The skin Blu decided to use makes it look and feel like a bunch of 16 year old kids tweaked it to something they thought looked "cool".  Easy fix,  use Nova or Google Now launcher and all is forgiven.Can't use duel sim and a MicroSD card at the same time.  Though the memory and ram upgrade (32gbs and 3gbs respectively) are more than enough for me, adding a 64 gb card will mean only using one sim card. As one slot is for a card or a sim.... It's not just this phone, but this is the one Im reviewing.No fingerprint scanner.  Can't use a lot of the new instant pay service without one.  Though at the 119 usd I paid for it, I can't complain to much.That's it with the cons. It's basically a phone on par with most flagship devices at a 1/4 of the price.I always buy unlocked carrier free versions of the phones I use as my daily driver.  The Vivo XL2 is without a doubt the best value I have ever gotten in a cell phone.  Is it the best phone ever??  Of course not.  Even Blu themselves sell better all around devices.  HOWEVER,  the XL2 may indeed be the best 149 dollar smart phone available as of March 2017.

column4: Update - don't waste your money!  A pretty solid four stars.  Could have been better.
column5: Update seven months in:  I've had to go from four stars to just one.  The phone worked well for about six months, though the shiny slippery back is very annoying.  But for the last month the phone has been almost unusable, and today it's become basically a brick. People who call me say they get busy signals. The phone itself freaks out. It will be normal, and then suddenly the app I'm using closes and the screen quickly flips through all the pages and then freezes on the add widget page. This happens when I'm just sitting there reading a Kindle book, typing a reply to a text, or browsing the web.  The phone will also suddenly refuse to accept input on the touch screen, or will shut down the keyboard when I'm typing.  I'll get a text, try to answer it, and the phone will shut down.  It's like it's gone insane or something.  I've tried everything, factory reset, all the updates, and even tried to get help from BLU.  All of my attempts to contact them were ignored.  Now I have to go out and try yet again to buy another phone!  I've had it with BLU and no longer recommend it.  I expect to get more than six months out of a phone!!!In the box :  phone, charger, wall adapter, headphones, screen protector, and silicone case.  Phone also had a screen protector already installed. This is my third BLU phone.  I'm disappointed that this one has a sealed battery, and if you do need two SIM cards, you can't use a  SD card.  There are only two slots, instead of three.  The fancy back that they make sound so awesome is anything but; it's not even really blue or shiny except in the brightest sunlight, and the surface is so slippery that the phone is hard to hold on to, and takes every opportunity to slide off the arm of the chair, the desktop, the nightstand, the dashboard, or anywhere else you might want to set it down.  It also has a few more quirks than my other BLUs  and was a little cranky over getting my favorite apps customized.  As much as the phone is an obvious attempt at an iphone clone, it doesn't seem to have as good an antenna as the iphone.  Meetings in an interior room in a large building mean I have no signal but I can hear coworkers phones getting texts.  That's not a huge deal for me as those meetings are only once a month and otherwise the signal is pretty reliable, and I didn't pay anywhere near $600 for the name brand.On the plus side, it does have plenty of onboard memory and readily connected with my net10 SIM card.  Apps work quickly, music sounds pretty good, and calls are clear.So overall a decent deal.  Just make sure you order a nice case when you order the phone, otherwise you'll be dropping the phone all the time, and the case that comes with it is an ugly whitish color that is just repulsive.A cautionary tale:  My first BLU phone was the  Life XL and I was very happy with it, all the utility of a $600 samsung or apple product at a fraction of the price.  Easy to set up and worked very well with my net10 account.  I"d still be using it if I hadn't dropped it on cement and made the display go all wonky.  The phone still worked just fine, but the screen was too blurry to live with.  So I ordered an identical Life XL.  Unfortunately that one came loaded with spyware. I filed a complaint with the seller, tojostore, but they refused to respond until I left bad feedback.  Then they quickly refunded my money without even asking for the phone back, so they know they were guilty.  Lesson learned, always buy just from Amazon, and immediately run a malware checker before putting any contacts or other personal information on the phone!

column4: Spyware still. Come on Blu get it together!
column5: Still has a security issue,waiting on Blu to respond 3 different malware detection apps,found stuff. Update: sent Blu screenshots of the all the stuff my spyware detection apps found stilllllll waiting for a response. (Update) 3-17-17 received email back from Blu they said their working on a update to fix the data breach, they better, this app Data ghost or data clone has super user permissions and can do whatever the heck it wants. I'm done with Blu forever This BS app even tryed to hide what it's doing

column4: Absolutely amazing for this price range
column5: The first time it hit the ground the screen cracked.  I contacted BLU support who told me that there are no replacement screens available for this model.  The screen protector is the only thing holding it together.Included in the box is a 5v 2.0a charger, micoUSB cable, USB-OTG cable, earbuds with microphone, rubber phone case, screen protector, and one of those professional paper clips for opening the sim/SD card tray.  And, there was a screen protector already on the phone.The sim card / SD card tray is pretty flimsy, I wouldn't open it very often.  As other commentators noted, you can either have 2 sim cards or 1 sim card and 1 sd card.  You cannot have all three.The phone case does not fit correctly.  The lower right hand corner does not fully extend over the front edge of the phone, and it feels like the phone will slip out if I grab it by the case.  The case partially covers the microphone hole.There were a few Amazon apps pre-installed, but they had obviously been done so outside of the google play store as they would not update without asking the user to modify their app installation permissions.  Luckily, I was able to fully uninstall them.  After disabling what I didn't want and installing some basic google apps, it says I have used 11 GB of 32 GB.  Luckily this phone has not partitioned the main storage into multiple segments to simulate an sd card like the BLU studio energy.The display is stunning.  Good contrast between colors, very bright, and the curved edges are neat.Overall, I think this thing is perfect for $150.  But if you drop the screen, there is no replacement.

I have to give this 5 stars! For the price this is a phenomenal deal. I waited 2 weeks to write a review and I must say this is a great phone! Looks good, works really well, storage is terrific. I did download the Evie go Launcher because I didn't like the stock launchers but that is all! I am never spending 700 on a phone anymore as long as BLU makes affordable awesome devices like this vivo xl2.

Got it today as described It's very nice, runs smoothly can play games smoothly takes excellent pictures (at least to me it does). The sound quality is perfect, video playback is good it's fast and the storage is not bad just perfect for me. For the people who said that they couldn't see the symmetry on the back of the phone as it was showed/described in the picture I'mma say this...LIES...if you hold it up at an angle literally don't have too, but you clearly can see it. The last and only #1 CON about this phone is yea, its true...that you are not able to use your sd/memory card if you're using 2 sims (the standard sim and or the micro/nano sim) MEANING you won't be able to use sd/memory card if you're using BOTH. For me only using 1 sim (3-in-1sim) i can say it's possible this phone does have dual sim so therefore in other words if you're using 2 sim cards you won't be able to your sd/memory card, BUT if you're using 1 not 2 but only 1 SIM (which is the standard size sim) then yes you ARE able to use your sd/memory card. This is through my knowledge and what I've experienced using BLU Vivo XL2.

column4: Nice phone and Price, but was does the warranty give you?
column5: Okay, I got the phone yesterday (4/4/2017) and was amazed by the stuff that comes with it for the price!  Ear buds, phone cover, screen protector,  USB 2.0 cord and charger.. It's a nice and sleek looking phone. Has Android 6.0  Marshmallow with it.  But I didn't get long enough time to play with it.  Why is that? The metal bracket on the SIM card tray fell off!  So I contacted Blu about it. Provided them the info they requested and included a picture showing what I was discussing. In case they were not sure.  I was told that cause this happened. It was void of warranty! And then told I need to pay to have it repaired!  Not even 24 hours old and I need to pay to get it fixed! WTF?!? Then they told me why not just contact Amazon to get a replacement! At least when contacting Amazon, they immediately fixed the issue and shipped out a new phone and took the old one back!  But still hard to believe this company refused to fix the issue. Would not believe that their product could have a manufacturer error on it! Something like this, the metal piece coming off the sim card tray should not void the warranty. After all, people need to use it to pull out the sim card to gain access to the memory card one is using also if they want to replace that with a new and better one!I like how the phone looks and the stuff it comes with. But I can not comment on how it is as a device.  Maybe when I get the other one I will update this review. So please be warned when buying! It's a shame this company did this!UPDATE! Had it for many months. It’s okay. But I am pissed off with the few updates they did. It was to add spam and spyware! And you can’t remove it!  Also still has the Security issues!  And was to.d back in April that they would have update to Nougat. And still being told it’s coming! It’s now 2018 and still no update! Just more spam and bloatware to slow it down!

column4: Great Phone with a nice OS. Earpiece speaker is not as loud as I'd like.
column5: Everything works great only downside is the earpiece speaker is quieter than my previous Note 4. I work in an office setting so its quiet in here even then the earpiece speaker is hard to hear unless pressed firmly against your ear.

column4: Good looking quick phone but don't drop it
column5: The os and speed is ok but do not drop it! I bought this phone for my wife a week ago and my she  was carrying it in her hand and bumped the car door and it fell around 2-3 feet to the ground and the screen shattered it was really disappointing for a phone with "gorilla glass 3"  the phone is nice looking and pretty quick but if you drop your phone a lot then this isn't the phone for you. it took one drop in my case to become a paper weight

column4: Good evening I have had the Blu VIVO XL2 for ...
column5: Good evening  I have had the Blu VIVO XL2 for almost three weeks now and  I must agree with  most of the people on here that this phone is great and for all those who are complaining. stop it  .  this is my third Blu phone in the last 7 years and each phone that I have brought from Amazon was better then the one before.  I have owned all the phones from Iphone  all the way down to the G-1. it takes a little time to get around and learn it but its fun doing it.  and you can buy  a  AMOR CASE WITH KICK STAND .  I will keep you inform .  but as of 9/20/2017 this phone is one of the best buys you can get for your money,Up dateIt's now the 27rh of September and my Vivo XL2 is working just Beautifully. Has been dropped and with the Amor case  didn't have to worry one second. Camera is great and a whole lot of fun. Total Charge in 2 hours. Fast operating  I read that the earbuds were no good. Man who ever said is deaf the ear buds sound just great great bass and really high highs. And the mid-range isn't a joke at all. Doesn't stall or slow down at all. And I charge my about every fourteen hours and for those who think  that's to Soo. Your nuts I'm on my phone all day long with no breaks. Bottom line you can't get a better phone then this for the price.  Thank you BLU for another great one

I really like the phone.  My only real problem with it is that the triangle and square navigation buttons are reversed compared to other phones that I have had experience with.  While this is a small thing, it is a nuisance.  I know that this is my own fault because you can see this on the pictures of it but I didn't notice.  I had another BLU phone and it lasted until the warranty expired (95-100 days).  I have had this one for a couple of months now and so far, no problems.

UPDATE :I have owned this phone for just over 2 & 1/2 mos, and yesterday it went blooey!The phone was sitting on a desk when it began to cycle through a reboot process - this happened several times before the reboot completed to where the phone could be used.I checked it out, and it seemed fine. but about an hour later it went totally dead during use - - it would not turn on nor recognize any charger, no light came on to even acknowledge that a charger was attached.Later, when *trying* to get tech support I went to get my SIM card out of the phone and it was HOT to the touch - ACK!!!The BLU support site is a nightmare - you can not leave an email to ensure they got your support request, just a phone number... and it took multiple attempts to get their system to accept a support ticket.I have yet to hear from them, and I have the phone in a cooler in the garage in a ziplock bag with plastic ice packs :(Are they using the same batteries as the Note 7?!?Former review when phone was working :If you want a phone for calls, messaging, and a couple of app games at a reasonable price, this is it.I received it running Android 6.0 (it has not yet updated to 6.0.1, and I suspect it won't)If you're used to Samsung (or LG, or whatever) bloatware, the stripped down version running on this will look good - until you realize what it *doesn't* do.It means fewer options.Yes, you can ad apps for that, but since these impact processing, it'll slow the phone down.And this phone can't handle much in the way of processing.If you use your phone more often than a laptop or home computer to surf the 'net, this phone will frustrate you.Open more than 2 or 3 windows, or if you have any other apps running in the background, the Vivo XL 2 will often freeze up for a few moments or go black briefly - the Blu version of 'little spinning circle, I suspect.Doesn't crash, just - annoyingly slow.Sometimes it will take so long to load a page, the phone asks if you want to crash your browser...Don't bother, just pretend you're on dial-up... And it happens whether I'm out of the house with full bars or on WiFi with strong signal.Don't waste your money if the 'net access matters, go for it if you just need a dumbphone.For me, this is a (hopefully) temporary replacement for a Note 4 until the Note 8 comes out.If I had to use this phone for more than a few months I wouldn't keep it.When I'm done with it, though, it'll be handed off to a WAY less picky household member.YMMV...

Loving this so far...lots of space and working great for me....I have only had it for several days now. My last Blu phone is still working and I had it for 3 years so I am hoping I get better results from this one. I just wanted a newer model.2018-01-20Updated reviewI have had this phone lest than 2 months and I seems to have shut down on me. A wireless update was done last night and from then the phone started to malfunction.....it was working great up to that point. I am so annoyed right now.....who is going to refund me or give me a new phone?.....it costs too much money to send this back from Barbados. I cannot access anything in the phone, make any calls or receive any.....it would not even power off but all I am seeing is a black screen with an orange line surrounding it nothing else......so frustrated....I paid over $400BDS for this phone. My last Blu phone lasted over 3years and is still working but I gave it away.....what am I to do now.

I've been using this phone now for almost 2 months. My previous phone was a Samsung Galaxy s6. Overall, the phone is very nice. It has a nice, heavy feel. It takes decent pictures and I love the dual SIM option as well as the great storage and memory card slot. There were a few things that I found disappointing and it could just be that I'm comparing it to a much more expensive phone.For one, I don't like having ads on my home screen. I can live with it, but It's a pain.Two, the ringer volume is terrible. At It's max, I miss text messages all the time at work. Even when the phone is right in front of me. Yes my work is loud, but if my Samsung is in front of me, I hear a text.Three, I was a little disappointed that I couldn't personalize my home screen as nicely. I tried downloading several apps for themes and after they were added, I only got a background pic. I never got the theme icons. On that same note, I was disappointed that I can only change the size of the font, not the style.I was hoping to use the dual SIM feature to make this phone both my personal and work phone so I don't have to carry 2. But not only can I not hear the notifications well enough, I worry that the phone will not be powerful enough to handle dual phone tasks. I may upgrade to another phone and give this one to my 10 year old. She would be absolutely thrilled with it.
Super smart phone. Veery cheap on price but has great features. Has Android 6 preloaded which is an okay system. Great for the techie on a budget. Great screen and reception on MetroPCS

Bought one for my wife in April.  Impressed, so I bought one for myself.  Done a lot of research and looked at a lot of phones.  Can't beat this one for the price.  Comes with 32GB memory.  More that enough for a lot of apps.  Phones with less memory have not worked for me.  Have not had a problem with either one (one gold, one blue).  Have to charge it daily which is standard for most smart phones.  Comes with case and screen protector.  Wifi works extremely well.  Blu uses a charger that is unique to Blu.  Can buy extras at Amazon.  Used camera sparingly, but is great for my purposes.  Not hard to learn to use.  Similar to a lot of other brands.  Used it as a bring your own phone (BYOB)to Tracfone.  Had no problems activating it.  Used chat instead of calling.  Nice big, bright screen (5.5").  Have down streamed baseball, movies, etc.  One negative is that if it is used with Bluetooth (headphones), it will only work for calls, not down streaming movies, music, etc. To do that, have to use plug in headphones.  Overall a very good phone.  Sleek, thin and has a very nice touch.,  Have had several people ask me about it when using in public.  Most have not heard of Blu.

column4: So far it has been excellent! It feels
column5: I have had this phone for two weeks. So far it has been excellent! It feels, looks and operates like an expensive phone. For the price you can't beat it!!!

column4: Terrible customer support and fixing procces
column5: The screen went black just after the return period. So I had to deal with Blu support center, they insisted I perform a series of steps even when I told them the screen was completely black, after giving then serial #, purchased date, they insisted they want model number and a picture of the original box showing the bar codes and all that stuff. It took 2 days to get understand the information they wanted (because they insisted they need the model number) and I didn't know the model number it was the name of the phone. So finally they approved the verification and gave me address to ship phone (I had to pay shipping to their wherehouse) even though it was a defective device but they were kind to remaind me that if it was water damage or any other my fault I had to pay return shipping (just in case I wanted a broken phone back in my hands). Will never buy Blu again.

column4: My wife has used the Energy 2 for over a year and it is still excellent. The phones seem to come with an increasing ...
column5: This is the 3rd BLU phone I've bought from Amazon.  I broke the screen on my Studio HD 5.0 Friday and had this at my doorstep Saturday afternoon.  I used the Studio HD for about 3 years and it was noticeably slowing.  My wife has used the Energy 2 for over a year and it is still excellent.  The phones seem to come with an increasing number of junk apps, but a quick launcher upgrade relegates them to the junk drawer where they belong.  Overall the quality and hardware exceeds what I would expect for the money, making BLU's phones a great value.  I also appreciate that the company is Florida based while they are manufactured in Asia just like every other phone.
I had a Blu Vivo XL, which took a swim, so I got the new version.  I loved the first version, but I like this version even better.  GREAT PRICE.  Quality phone.  I am very, very pleased with it.

column4: Best phone I've owned, definitely worth the money
column5: Let me start by saying that this is the best phone I've ever owned. I've owned about 8 phones, three of which were also BLU phones. I wouldn't say it's the best phone out there, but for the price... Wow.This phone does a lot for a phone that is only $150. It looks and feels great, it's pretty fast, and, best of all, comes packed with interesting features. It has a built in fake call app, for example, for when you need to slip out of awkward situations. Now that is something else.Back on a serious note, it's a nice size, in my opinion. Not tiny but not too big. I can hold and use it comfortably. Call quality is clear and I've yet to have any issues with connecting to WiFi or the cell network. The phone also comes with a case, a screen protector already on it (and no annoying bubbles!), And an extra screen protector, should you need it. It also comes with a charger, some sort of adapter (admittedly, I don't know what it is for, so refer to another review for that answer), and a pair of earbuds. For an audio guy such as myself, the earbuds sound quite disgusting, but for average users, they should be fine.The only issue I've had with the phone itself was when I first got it. It took some time for the phone to recognize my SIM card. That was a bit frustrating, but once solved, the issue never arose again. I will say, though, that if you need to use two SIM cards, you will be unable to use a micro SD as the Micro SD and one of the SIM slots are the same slot. For me, it's no issue as I only need one SIM, but I felt it worth mentioning. The phone has 32 GB of internal space, which is more than enough for me, so I don't even need to use my SD card.There are better phones out there, obviously. But you'll be spending at least $600 to get them. This phone is way too good for the price. Thank you again, BLU, for an amazing product.

Great phone husband says it's better then his I phone 6s n that's a supprise it way faster n has many more great things u can figure out on ur phone it's compatible w strait talk n at a well. U don't even have to use wifi for faster speed it's super fast n all in one he bought one for me to n I love it!

column4: I absolutely love this! I don't normally do a review so ...
column5: I absolutely love this! I don't normally do a review so soon (after only two days). However, this has exceeded my expectations to the point that if anything went wrong at this point, it would still be a winner in my book. Where do I start? I'll start off with the bad. I didn't care for the launcher that they use. It's very juvenile. But I always use Microsoft launcher anyway, so it wasn't a big deal. The launcher that it comes with places all of your apps on the screen. Ew! But, as I said before, that's an easy fix! I love the fact that almost everything you need is on the phone without a million and one apps. You got your barcode scanner in your camera app. Someone should have thought of that ago. You also have the option to record phone calls through your regular call app. Never saw that before. Back to the camera. It's awesome for such a low budget phone! It's almost too good! Normally your front-facing cameras don't catch your pores so well. I'll be using touch up features for that part. Lol! I love the business card scan option. It lets you scan business cards into your contacts. The free updates to Nougat didn't go so well though! Tried everything but had to factory reset. That wasn't fun. The 3GB of temporary memory is everything! I never knew that was the reason my old phone wouldn't load content very well. I thought it was my data usage allowance giving me hell! The speaker is on the back. But, honestly, who plays media through the phone speaker anymore? It's a nice-sized phone with a pretty sleek design! The charger that comes with it charges pretty decent. However, battery life could be a little better! I live with chargers all around me. So, it's not a problem for me. Kinda comes with the territory. I haven't been able to find how to make the battery notification tell me my percentage yet. I'll keep looking. The option to "close all" at the recent task menu is everything! It keeps the phone clean and working fast without the hassle of swiping then one by one all of the time! I've said enough. This phone is worth it!

column4: Good phone, disastrous update to Android 7
column5: i have been very happy with this phone. UNTIL I gave in to the nagging and updated to Android 7. It deleted all my photos and downloaded PDFs, created strange-looking, strangely colored icons, deleted all my home screen bookmarks, made several apps unusable, and corrupted my 64 GB SD card so that it was unreadable either in the phone or on a PC and I had to throw it out. I had to restore the phone, which then automatically updated to Android 7. If you want to update to Android 7, back up all your data to a computer (i tried to back up to the SD card but couldn't do the PDFs or screen shots), remove the SD card, and restore the phone. Otherwise the phone works well and has a strong broadcast signal that I use as a hotspot with great success.

BLU has become my new favorite. The camera is fantastic, it's easy to customize and comes with great preinstalled apps such as the Amazon app. The phone is easy to navigate and has terific battery life. The first phone I got had some blue tooth issues, but that went away with an update. (I got a new one because my son decided mine needed to be a fish. My second one did not have any Bluetooth problems at all) Also when I got my first one (almost 6 months before this review) there weren't alot of case options. Now there are quite a few unique case designs. I think BLU is a fantastic product and also decently priced. I've fallen in love. When it's time for me to upgrade I will go BLU.

I love this phone. I have had it for over 6 months now, and the performance and features are awesome. I recommended it to my brother, and he bought one and feels the same. The value of this phone is incredible. The phone is very attractive and slim with a large display. It offers so much at  a great price point. I tell everyone about BLU now, and no one I know has ever heard of them, but when I show them what a great phone I have, they want to know more. This is a great American product.
Liked it at first, but there's really no accessories out there and they've been in the news at least twice for having spyware in the firmware

I love this phone. It has a lot of features and it is better than I expected. I have had it for a while now and I am pleased. I think the picture quality could be better. If taking flawless pics is important for you then this phone may not be for you. However the phone is fast and the screen is the perfect size for me. I have has situations where the phone freezes and I have to close application running in the background or restart. Overall, I love this phone and I would recommend it.

First time purchase of the BLU brand I came from Samsung and was looking for a phone that could handle my rough use everyday. The phone is sleek comfortable in your hands. It comes with headphones and adapter for USB a rubber case and a charger.Pros: large display, fast reaction on the keyboard.  Has 20Gb of true internal storage. The rest is preloaded apps that are embedded in to the store. Operating system is good no glitches and very responsive to the Android platformCons: no expansion on memory the speaker is located on the back side away from you. So if you watching a YouTube video on a table the sound may be muffled.Overall the device is a good product price point is Affordable and I received the phone probably in the mail with no issues. Try it out.

column4: has other irritating issues but won't waste my time on those
column5: Several issues with phone, one the gold glaze color makes it hard to see the square, circle, and back arrow in light and no light, has other irritating issues but won't waste my time on those.  Could have been better engineered.  Missed my calling I guess.

I love this phone. I have had it for quite awhile now and haven't had any problems. It looks good, it is very responsive and it takes pretty good pictures. Oh, and it makes phone calls. LOL. Seriously, I my last 3 phones have been BLU phones and I have never been disappointed. My only complaint is that the battery is not replaceable. But I guess by the time the battery starts to fail, I will be ready for an upgrade anyway.

column4: That's the best part it last me allday
column5: I dont know why people are bashing the battery? That's the best part it last me allday. And its not like I dont use it i actually do alot on it and the battery last. The battery is even better than the BLU energy x2 I had. This is honestly the best phone I ever had. Plenty of storage space. It works very fast. Does not lag. You would think I paid more for it, My wife loves it too. Im happy with my purchase. I waited more than a month to write this review because I was waiting to see If the battery gives out.

So I've owed this phone for going on 6 months.  I use Stright talks AT&T sim (bring you own phone).  This phone is buy far the best phone I've ever owned besises my all time favorite LG Optims Q.  Blu Vivio XL 2 is extremly fast it out runs my sisters new s7 which is crazy $700 phone.  well atleast my blu runs that fast cant say that for the others.  No isues with my phone would buy again!

This is the 2nd Vivo XL2 I bought. The first one I dropped and shattered the screen a month after I bought it. For the price the phone is a keeper. Why pay $1000. for a phone your probably going to replace in a couple years anyway. I have had no issuses with this phone. Two days after I bought it it updated to Android 7.0. I did however switch from the BLU Carefree launcher, which I didn't like, to the Google launcher. This is the 4th BLU phone I have bought and this one is my favorite.

column4: Great phones. Speedy response times when switching apps
column5: Great phones. Speedy response times when switching apps, downloading, surfing the internet. Very happy with this purchase. Never hard of BLU before did some research, great bang for the buck. You won't be sorry.

Been using this phone for about 8 months now.  Like all phones, it has it's pluses and minuses.  All in all, it does what I need it to do, so I'm satisfied with it.  Battery life is about 8 to 12 hours depending on how you use your phone.  If you play games, on social networks, etc.  It has the tendency to drain the battery quickly, but you can recharge the phone with the wall charger in about an hour.  Car charger takes a bit longer.

Love this phone which is exactly like a Samsung right down to the toughness of the case, gorilla glass and inner software. Have used with 2 SIMS in different countries and also one SIM and a memory card. Android 7.0 (Nougat) update just downloaded easily and I have a Windows overlay installed which works seamlessly. Battery still going strong and easy charge. I'd buy another BLU phone in a heartbeat. Unbelievable value.

There are several things I don't like about this phone. However I will list the pros and consPros:-Large display-Very bright-Virtually no lag with normal everyday use-Large battery lasts me all day on one charge with light to medium usage-The cameras are decent.Cons:-LACK OF APP DRAWER(seeing all my apps on multiple screens is less desirable. Not to mention ugly since they are not in any specific order. A custom launcher is warranted.)-Less than adequate speaker.-bloatware(never had bloatware on Blu before)-Tends to heat up in the pocket with the screen off.-Home and navigation buttons are too small. I find myself having to press one of them several times before it registers the action.Update 9/23/2017:Phone will no longer connect to WiFi unless I reset my router first. Even with the most recent wireless update. This is a major concern considering what I paid for this device.Update 3/17/18:Phone is almost completely useless now. The charging port is broken or loosened. I can no longer use the device while charging. The slightest movement disconnects the charger.

Unlocked, dual SIM ( well, that is if you don't install a micro memory card, but then again, the phone's memory is big enough so you don't need additional memory anyway ). Beautiful screen resolution and fast response when switching between applications. This cellphone is a perfect blend of utility, size and bang for your dollar. Blu cellphones are awesome. This is my second Vivo XL and my next, will also Bea Blu device.Highly recommended phone, just make sure you get it from this seller. It arrived well packed and sooner than expected.

column4: Started having issues after android update
column5: I bought the phone on July 2017, so I have had it for the last 8 months. The phone was great initially, very good performance for the price. Camera was decent. However, after I updated to Android 7.0, it started having multiple problems. First the microphone stopped working, I got it fixed by turning off Google voice assistant. However, it still has a ghost-touch issue where the phone keeps exiting from apps or switches between apps without user input. In addition the battery life is now much worse than before.This is my first Blu phone and I don't think I will ever buy from them again.

column4: ... this phone after reading reviews thinking it would be good. I loved it at first

Now it won't download NOTHING I WANT or update NOTHING!!! All it says is download pending!! I was gonna put a good review but not now! Don't waste your money on this product!!!

Went into his room where the phone was plugged up and the charging port on the phone was smoking!  Now the port is all burnt out and unable to charge and i can't even get a refund for the phone!  This is ridiculous cause this is the fourth Blu I have brought that has malfunctioned in a short time. I am really disappointed in their products lately and they always seem to act up when it's past the return period.

Phone works fine but the battery drains faster than any phone I've had in the last 5 years.I removed all of the apps the came with it. After 5 days I'm starting to get ads for apps in my notifications. The apps are known to not be safe. A quick Google search will show a history of problems with this phone coming with spyware. For that reason alone I cannot recommend the phone. Not happy2nd update: 10 days later the phone is now randomly powering off. battery was not low. both times today it was above 40% there's now more spyware as well. returning this garbage

column5: Please note after activating my Antivirus on the phone it detected a malware. (Android communication sync). Believe it or not it actually came with the phone. Despite my best efforts I am unable to disable or remove this malware. So disappointed.

It was weird, but manageable. I'm not rough with my phone, it has a case & screen protector. I haven't dropped it or gotten it wet. Lots of space to store things & with a 16g SD card I still have over 2/3 of storage left (I have a lot of songs, movies, apps) other than the phone now falling apart with no reason & no response from Blu it was a good phone. Still think the Blu Energy was the BEST from them

Some of you gave it a bad review because it didn't work right but don't forget it's massed produced like anything else that's why you have a warranty either give it another shot or get your money back it's up to you.

I Love Love my new phone. The finish on the back is real nice. It also comes with a protective clear case for the back side. One of my daughter's has an Apple phone and she says she likes mine better. Activating this phone was actually quite easy.

Really like my phone. Most expensive one I've ever bought but so far it's worth it. It's super fast and responsive. No lags or freezes. Good layout, some things a little quirky but nothing bad. Call quality and signal great, very lightweight and camera pretty good too

column4: Beautiful phone. Very nice and it arrived fast
column5: Beautiful phone. Very nice and it arrived fast. The only problem as soon as it was in contact with water it stopped working. I know it’s not water proof but some phones still work after being in contact with water. Not this one. Other than that great phone for the price. Nice quality.

Not sure what Gorilla Glass is used for but dropped this from 12"-14" on to linoleum and the screen shattered easier than the dreams of freedom of a death row inmate.Love the phone, only had it two days but it's been flawless on every level (wish I could say the same and not dropped the damn thing), except the glass. Gorilla Glass doesn't seem to be any stronger than other screen glass.I'm glad they included an extra screen protector, needed it to keep the pieces of glass in place so it's still somewhat functional.

Very good purchase however, after two months...the screen started freezing and doing its own thing. Contacted Blu...they recommended a hard factory reset...Problem still exist. They asked that I send it back to them for repairs. Unable to send mine because I don't have a spare phone to use. Hopefully, they can find the problem and send out an automatic update.

Amazon return service excellent.  will not buy this brand.a lot app preinstalled by BLU.  when I set the pin, it become very difficult to operate. without pin, it run ok, but very easy to freeze.  1.7 G Ram used when not open any of your own app.

column4: Not bad but not great either
column5: Ok, I have had this phone for a few months now and I like it but dont love it. Nice screen size, the resolution doesnt bother me in the slightest. My issues are all evolved around mem and cpu.  Get into any intensive graphics and you get a lot of slow down. Its not really a gaming phone.Now here are the issues I have on a constant basis. Apps closing for no reason. You go into them, and before you can do anything the app may just shut down on you. try again and this time it works. This behavior happens with several apps and games.The latest update which came out a week or so ago introduced Ads into the remote control app which is stock with the phone and I didnt even use it but boom, all kinds of ads coming up every day. Had to disable the app (you cant uninstall it) and uninstall the apps update in order to get rid of the ads. Come on, who wants ads on their phone? Blue help app has also started throwing up some ads as well. You are already using lesser hardware to make the phone cheap, do we really need ads added? Come on BLU, get your act together on this. I took away a full star for adding these ads into the default apps that come on the phone.Other random issues. You get a news update, if it sets there for more than say 20 minutes and you finally tap on it to read it, it opens the opera browser, goes to the article and displays a blank page. If you open up another tab you can see the first tab populated but as soon as you go back to it, its blank again. If you read the news alerts right away, they work perfectly fine and display like they are supposed to.There are lots of little software glitches like this on this phone. It can be very annoying at times. If you just need a phone with a few apps to get you by, I would recommend this phone. If you want to make this phone your primary internet device, stay far away from it. Just way to glitchy and to slow. Im not sorry I bought it, I needed a tide me over till the note 8 comes out and this is working for me despite the issues.

column4: I would've given it 5 stars but...
column5: This is a GREAT phone for the money.  32g of data, 2g of RAM, awesome camera with GREAT resolution, but not so great at night.  Otherwise, best bang for the buck!

(I picked this phone because its camera specs matched up to my old phone's camera, but it is definitely not on the same par...) Also, there are minimal widgets and no VIEWABLE clipboard. I was very spoiled by my last phone (LG G FLEX 2)...BUT....For the price, the BLU VIVO XL2 is completely worth it.
Great phone. RAM memory makes a huge difference and the 32gb of internal memory makes it all easy. Great phone for a fair price.

It has all the perks of an expensive phone including lots of RAM, lots of storage, huge screen, great cameras, and on top of all of that, it's unlocked!Great purchase, highly recommend for others.

column4: This phone is not worth buying.

I bought it for my niece in Trinidad, the first thing she noticed is that it gets overheated very quickly.  after about 2 mths the volume went, the phone would not ring at all. This is a great phone. There is a learning curve since I switched from an iPhone but it is a good phone.

column4: NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME
column5: DO NOT PURCHASE! WARNING DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! I bought this phone just a little over a month ago. I can not make phone calls from it now. When it first happened I thought maybe it was because my phone hadn't been shut off or rebooted for awhile, so I did that. Then it happened again. Same thing, after reboot did okay. Today it was acting up and I had restarted my phone just an hour or so ago. My return time just ended a few days ago. It looks like I wasted my money and will be looking for a new phone.

Love these phones!  I ordered the original XL and loved it so when my hubby and I needed new phones I ordered these. Very happy with them!  Fast and full of space!  Bright clear screen and fast app activity!

column4: BLU are the words I say and what I think
column5: I've had this product for 6 days now and regret I didn't get this phone before I bought the iPhone 6 Plus a year ago. After six days of use, I can honestly say that this phone takes the punishment and keeps performing like a soldier. I already dropped this phone on accident (during a hand-off to my son) on concrete and thanks to the silicone case that came with this phone by default, there are no visible scratches or nicks and the phone's functionality has not suffered one bit. I've always been partial to Android OS and have not been disappointed since I made the switch from the Apple iOS to Android. It came with a screen protector on the phone already yet it came with a second one as a replacement. It also came with a silicone case, head-buds that sounds really good, fast charger and a beautiful box to stuff all these accessories in it. For $149.00 I got a hell of a bargain. I didn't have to purchase additional accessories like you would with other new phone purchases. I have people asking me about this phone consistently as it looks very pleasing to the eye. I didn't get this phone as a fashion statement, I got it because of the strong functionality that it kicks out. I'm not sure why other consumers have claimed they have had negative experiences (maybe because they are the competition) and they see this phone as a threat to their bottom line. Either way, if all you care about is a solid phone that does what you want it to do, that functions as smoothly as it looks....I advise you get it!

This phone costs 145 dollars.  Guess what?  It's a great phone!  I feel absolutely comfortable recommending this phone.  It does not have some of the bells and whistles of an 800 phone.  For me, it's perfect

column4: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this phone, but had to return it. Not their fault.
column5: I loved it but I had to return it because I had Net10 and used Verizon through them. If --- in the last three months or so -- your service has gone from good (or great) to cruddy on Net10, you need to be aware that (according to the customer service rep I spoke to for 2.5 hours about the problem)  the Verizon folks "upgraded" their tower equipment to CDMA and this is a GSM phone that would no longer work with the closest tower. It did reach out beyond the closest and sometimes get me service, but it was patchy and unreliable. IF the tower had remained GSM this phone would have been a real winner for me. I loved it. But, due to the service provider's change, it didn't work out for me. I wish it had. I wound up with an iPhone 5s and I prefer this one. BLU, however, (I also spoke to them about their phones)  doesn't have any CDMA phones, unfortunately. I told them to fix that.

This phone has been working well for me. It has plenty of storage for all your apps and music. Easy to use. It's almost perfect. I think the Blu help support could be better. You download the manual and it is not great.

column4: BEWARE: this Phone comes preloaded with SPYWARE
column5: The phone itself is decent and a great price however it comes preloaded with Chinese SPYWARE. For that reason, I can't recommend it.  Blu phones are rebranded from Gionee in China. The spyware is installed as a system app, which was discovered by running the Malwarebytes program and confirmed as such by other Android security sites.  So far this phone has been impossible to root.  I have ways to disable spyware but it's not something the average person knows how to do or is even aware of. Amazon should not be selling this phone until the issue is resolved.

Knowing I was coming from an iPhone I was actually expecting this phone to be awful. Aside from having to get used to a few differences, this phone is really good so far. A few things I still need to figure out but otherwise it is just as fast and just as good as my iPhone 6s. I do love how long the battery lasts but I do hate how much longer it takes to charge. column4: Great Smartphone at a Great Price!
column5: I've had this phone since the release date. So far I absolutely love the Vivo XL2! Out of the box I installed my ATT sim card and SD card, powered it up, transferred my apps and contacts from my old phone and I was ready to go. It loads apps quickly and much more efficiently than my old LG G3.The battery life is fantastic. Again, my old phone was good for six hours before it needed a charge (15% battery remaining), and that was with the screen dimmed and minimal usage. With moderate use and decent screen intensity I can go for 10-12 hours before it gets to 20%.The camera is decent although lacking in some features, such as panoramic view and slow motion video. But for the price I'm willing to overlook it. Picture quality is better than most phones were just a few short years ago.For my purposes there are two shortfalls with this phone. First, there is no Near Field Communication, so Android Pay is a no go. I was big on Android Pay with my old device, so it was an adjustment going to this phone. Second is the availability of cases. With the exception of the flimsy rubber case included, there are no cases available for this phone. I hope this situation takes care of itself soon.Overall I'm very satisfied with my purchase.Update:Shortly after my review the phone started giving me serious issues with the touchscreen. For no reason the phone will roll back through all the previous screens in the app being used until it goes into the home screen edit mode. If you hit the home button Google comes up then the phone returns to the edit mode. Only way to get out of this state is to shut the phone off and on. Returned it to Blu (it was out of my possession for a month!) and it still gives me issues. I emailed them and they want me to do a hard reboot again, which didn't work in the past.To their credit Blu did replace it with a new phone.

I am a 1st time BLU user and I have no complaints thus far.  This device is definitely an upgrade from my previous device (PLUM).  The sleekness and gold color give it a high-end look and I am loving the features - 32GB storage, picture quality, etc.

column4: I love this phone, but I hate the charging issues
column5: I totally love this phone. I've been rocking it for a good 6-7 months at this point. It would be the perfect phone for me if it wasn't for issues with charging. I've looked into it but it seems like this is a pretty common problem for this phone. The charging port is not working correctly and is getting worse and worse. I'm not rough on my phone so I feel like this shouldn't be an issue. It also sometimes does this thing where the battery life will suddenly dive and the numbers on the charge will tick down in seconds. With that problem, it sounded more like a software issue rather than the battery, but I'm not 100% sure. The battery life overall seems to be poor compared to where it used to be. If wireless charging were supported that would be cool.Other than those issues I really do love this phone. The screen size, the speed, and the functionality of the phone is awesome. Looks like I might have to dig through warranty things and see if it can be fixed.

column4: Poor Phone + Poor Customer Service = Poor Review
column5: Purchased the phone Sept. 2017, and by Nov. 2017 it had become totally unstable. It started toggling between apps or closing programs as if the phone was possessed. I contacted customer service, and they had me walk through a bunch of unnecessary steps. Each time I did what they told me to do, I had to hang up and call back into the queue. After doing this about 4 or 5 times, they finally told me to send the phone in. They said it would take 20 days to fix (IF they decide to fix it). I send it in, and they tell me there's something wrong with the calibration. They then go on to tell me "the only way this could happen is if you drooped the phone, so we won't be covering it under warranty". I know for a FACT that I never dropped this phone. I also know for a FACT that I will never order this phone again or recommend it to anyone else for purchase. CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EVERYTHING!

column4: BLU tells you the good, Here's the bad...
column5: Lots of little annoying things about this phone! As you can read on the specs of it, yes, the hardware and software on it is pretty cool for the price. But lots of things it CAN'T do. Such as:1) You cannot have different ringtones for different things. You can have a ringtone for calls, and then a tone for "Notifications". "Notifications" means email, text, and notification. Facebook fortunately has it's own tone built into their app, but I cannot set different tones for email or text message. So a single sound goes off and I don't know if it's an email or text message. NO WAY to change this!2) It comes with several built in apps that you cannot delete, and I bought mine unlocked.3) There is a TINY "key" that comes with the phone that opens the slot for SIM or SD cards. If you lose that, it'll be difficult to get into your phone.4) Speaking of SIM and SD cards, if you put an SD card in, you cannot use the dual SIM option.5) There is no built-in calendar. I had to download an app to display my Google calendar as a monthly calendar on one screen.6) It CONSTANTLY asks permission for every single app! And if you say yes, it still wants to take you to your settings and tells you to remove the "Overwrite apps" option....I do and it just resets a lot of times and keeps asking me?!? I've never had a phone ask for permissions to draw over other apps on every single app almost every single time! It's really annoying!This phone is quickly becoming not worth the cheap price. It works okay, but has lots of annoying little quirks that you have to download other apps to fix or just deal with. And the whole reason I bought this phone was for the storage capability.

It has everything u could want or need in a phone and so far I love it. It integrated my sd card into part of the internal memory which gives me triple memory. It's not just a partial or data memory but I literally have triple the usable memory. The only thing is I like to know how much battery I have at all times and I'm not sure if it will display or not I haven't found it yet if it's there
excellent phone
Excellent article!

This phone is awesome. Its perfect for people on a budget and it runs pretty good. I do however experience some lag here and there when I try to switch the rear cam to the front facing cam. A reboot fixed that, but I'm concerned it will do that again and I'm not so happy to reboot every time that happens. I don't use the camera much, but I just wanted to let everyone know about that issue. The default android on it is a bit plain so I suggest you put Nova Launcher on it to make it more personalized. I like that it comes with a case, a screen protector already on it so you don't have to worry about putting it on yourself and an extra screen protector with earphones and the charging cord. Overall, its a good phone to buy if you are just coming in to android or if you can't afford a higher end phone.

column4: ) The call quality is very good. Also supports Bluetooth connection (currently have my Bluetooth ...
column5: This phone caught me by surprise on how Decent (Quality wise) and how well it's performance is. I have had two Blu phones, first one did not have LTE for Cricket (At&t Co), this one does and I have brought it up North (Canada) and had 4G coverage with more than decent speeds. So far it DOES recognize 128gb micro SD cards, but be warned mines REQUIRED formatting (back up your data!!) The call quality is very good. Also supports Bluetooth connection (currently have my Bluetooth headphones connected, no issues). Also has Limited LED notification. I'm giving 5 starts not because it is a perfect phone (by no means it is), I'm giving it 5 stars for everything it delivers for the money your paying (bang for your buck)Camera - your back camera will look like your front (selfie) camera... Which is not really a good thing considering the back is supposed to have a higher megapixel count. Pictures get degraded once you zoom in. The Video by Contrast is actually VERY good and sharp (not sure why still photos don't mirror this)Battery - pretty solid. While it won't get you by a whole day of heavy usage without charging (youtube, Netflix, Google maps .....Amazon etc...), You will find that with heavy usage your phone will not Drain as quickly as you might expect and holds up pretty well. For an avg user (texting, occasional video) a day or more will suffice. Bonus: I have not experienced the back getting hot during heavy usage or accessing my rather extensive media content on my DAD card.Memory - As mentioned above, it recognized (after formatting) my 128gb SD. The Added 32 internal GB (use primarily for apps and updates) comes in handy and allows for you to obtain apps and app updates with out causing your phone to slow down from clutter. The 3gb ram also is Very Good for this.Ui - Blu's Ui and ......added ware is not really an issue and I sectionalized all of their icons to the last screen. Though I will mention their initial access screen (prior to lock screen) does have it's moments in accessing your camera or home page quickly...........yeh it has its momentsSpeaker - At best, the speaker is not the best. Do not be in a busy room and expect your peers to hear the sound on a video your showing with clarity.Leftouts - for those that care about these features, unfortunately the phone lacks the following:- Removable battery- Finger print scanner- Heart rate monitorSummary:For $149 this phone delivers what you need AND what you want and then some. It is an economic phone that brings near flagship quality to the table. You won't get everything, but you will get a lot for your money. While falling short of Apple or Samsung Expectations, you really could not ask for a better [Economic] phone.*Paid Full price with my own money*No promotion or sample given

I waited a couple of weeks after purchasing my BLU Vivo XL2 to write this review, so I could use it for a while before reviewing it. I love this phone! The screen is large and my videos and photos appear crystal clear and vivid. It took very little time to get my phone up and running: after I figured out how to insert my SIM card and my SD card, I was able to load all my contacts and my apps. Installation of everything was fast and easy.My previous phone was a Samsung Galaxy 5, and after just paying it off, the external speaker died. My husband's Galaxy 5 quit before mine did, so neither of us was happy about that or willing to replace it with the newest, $700 version. After doing research and reading reviews of all the options on Amazon, I decided to give this BLU phone a chance. From my experience with it so far, I can say that the BLU Vivo XL2 is the best phone you're ever going to get for such a low price. Honestly, I see no difference between my BLU phone and the Samsung I had before, and in fact the screen on my BLU is bigger, making it feel like a nice upgrade.I use my phone for the typical purposes: taking photos, reading email, texting, surfing the net, listening to music, and downloading documents to read and edit them. I am an educator, not a business person, so that may make a difference in my cell phone needs. Anyone who believes that the only good phones are made by Apple or Samsung, and who think you get that much "more" for the additional $500 or $600 will probably find things to complain about; but coming from the Galaxy 5 to this phone, I can easily say BLU has it beat.I was not a big fan of the app layout: the BLU doesn't come with an app drawer where you can put the apps you don't use often. But you can just download Nova Launcher, set up your home screen and apps the way you like, and you're all set.My only regret about this phone is that I didn't purchase it the week before, when there was a $99 flash sale. At the $149 I paid for this excellent phone, I got a great deal. At $99, it would be a steal!A recommendation: When you buy the phone, get the insurance plan. At $25 for 2 years, it's well worth it. It covers for water damage, broken screen, battery malfunction...all the common damages. I've dropped my phone a couple of times and so far, so good. But for the extra $25, it's worth it to know my phone will be replaced if I damage it.UPDATE (February 20, 2018):After having the phone for less than a year, and returning it twice for replacement and repair, I have decided to give up on it. It's unfortunate, since the phone could be great for the price. But the constant glitching, the "ghost apps" opening and closing on their own, is driving me crazy. BLU accepted the phone for repair under warranty, but the customer service was bad: no one ever contacted me to explain what was wrong with the phone; they shipped it back without any information regarding what they did to repair it. And the phone is still glitching. I ordered a Samsung Galaxy S7 phone and once it arrives I'm parting ways with this BLU phone!

column4: Yes, I fell for it, but you don't have to...
column5: Price seemed right, so I guess I took a shot... I assume many of you will read this and all the other reviews, good and bad, then do the same,  hoping you will be the lucky one.  It's sort of like a $160 lottery.  My advice: pay a few extra dollars, get a Samsung or some real brand and be finished with it.  I had a Samsung for a few years, was as good as new (I'm not into upgrading phones all the time, just not that important to me)... but my carrier (T-Mob) upgraded its network and I HAD to switch.  Checked everything, and the Blu seemed to have the basic features and speed I need.  Watched the video with some pseudo-geek opening the box and blathering about all kinds of statistics. Fine, I'm sold.The phone seemed to work fine at first, had to get used to the UI, which is never fun, but after a couple of weeks I had it figured out.  Reloaded my apps and seemed to be in good shape.  Nothing startling about the performance, the "long battery life & fast charging" didn't come true true but I really didn't care; I'm usually in a car and charge overnight so that is not a big issue with me (btw you can't change the battery).So here I am, just a couple of days shy of 3 months and out of the blue (no pun intended) the phone just stopped charging.  No drops, shocks, voltage spikes, etc etc. - just pfft - and it doesn't charge.  Unplug and re-plug and it starts to charge for like 30 seconds then stops; 3 different charges, 3 different cables, yeah, its the phone.  Go to my Amazon account and there is no "return" option for this device, slightly getting that sinking feeling... contacted the manufacturer.  After the customary overseas call-center "thank you for that information" (stop saying that!) and "Yes I understand sir" conversation, the result is I have to mail the phone to them and they will repair or replace with a new phone... in *10 to 15 days*.  Now, I don't know about you, but I simply cannot go for 15 days without my phone; I use it to conduct my business; waiting for 15 days is not an option.  Of course, I tried reasoning with the "manager" - you've been there - who repeated the exact same "we can only follow our standard return procedure" answer to every futile attempt I made to speed up the process. (Please, lady, at least say it slightly differently each time, try and make it sound like you're actually listening.)So I'm going to send in my phone and hope I'm the 9 day guy and not the 15 day guy (talk about lowering expectations) and have to make the decision if I double down on this disaster... Do I go and buy a REAL phone, or buy a flip-phone or some cheap alternative to fill the gap and keep as a backup for the next time -  and there WILL be a next time - I have to send the phone back?  Probably going with the REAL phone, because eventually this phone will be out of whatever warranty is covering me for this serviceSo, undoubtedly many of you who have read this far are still going to roll the dice - like I did.  But it has always been true and always will be: you get what you pay for.Good luck!

column4: Last update broke my phone. This may help someone if you're having audio issues after the update to 7.0
column5: This is the second time I have purchased this phone due to it being lost. I liked the first one so much that I purchased it again.Now for the real reason for this review: After the update yesterday to 7.0 I lost all call audio. I couldn't hear anything anyone said when making or receiving calls. This condition also effected blue tooth calling and the speaker phone feature. After a reset the device began working again so I loaded the usual apps and set it up the way I normally would and then it started acting up again. I then reset it again and paid attention to the issue after each application install and every change I had made to it. I figured out that the problem only occurred when I had the voice activated "OK Google" feature activated. So if you're having this issue deactivate the voice activated "OK Google" feature.Google account/settings/voice/voice match, and turn off: Say "Ok Google" any time.I hope this helps someone out and keeps them from pulling their hair out trying to figure out what's going on.

I've been a BLU customer for a while now, and decided to take the plunge with the Vivo XL2. Usually when I buy BLU, I'll find a happy medium of the lowest price combined with the most features available, and get away with a new phone for under $90. This time I decided to spend the few extra dollars, and get something that I had hoped would be a really nice phone, and not just a bare-minimum to get me through another year.  At first, I was really happy with the phone. The touch screen response time an app load times were short and crisp, the screen is bright and large, and overall, when the phone works, it does work really well.However, I didn't even get the chance to drop the phone a couple of times before it started developing a personality. Ever since I first got the phone, it has had a weird quirk where when I'm making a phone call, I can only hear the person on the other end about 20% of the time or less. There isn't any consistency as to when it happens, it's really just hit or miss. Again, I still have yet to actually drop my phone (and I have the BLU-version of an OtterBox case on this phone for when I do) so this issue isn't because of anything I have done since receiving the phone. It has the same problem after connecting/disconnecting Bluetooth headsets; however I've noticed that I'm more likely to hear the call if I use a Bluetooth headset than if I use the handset earpiece.Also, the battery life on this phone is rather disappointing. I wouldn't even bother mentioning it, but BLU felt that it was a selling point and brought up the "huge" battery this phone had in the ad on Amazon. All in all the battery works as you would expect, but don't expect to be going multiple days without having to charge up.Overall, I'm surprised that I've had less problems with the BLU phones that cost half as much as this one. Hoping that this isn't a theme, and will be sending in this phone for a replacement/repair as the issues aren't getting better.
This is our 3rd blu phone between my husband and I. Love it for the price + the case & screen protector comes with phone order.

column4: 9 Months of Daily Use: The Trip Report
column5: Multitasking has yet to present an issue and this phone has comfortably handled everything I've thrown at it. Even comes with some nice value-added stuff I wasn't expecting (pre-installed screen protector, TPU case, earbuds, IR blaster). Some marks against it:-Don't really care for the UI or a lot of the on-board apps; many of these are installed at the system level and can't even be disabled, either. Stock Android is fine and I sincerely don't understand why manufacturers have such a stick up their ass about actually sticking to it; BLU could definitely do much better here.-This phone will take decent photos under most circumstances, but trying to take panoramic photos on this thing is an almost Sisyphean task at times; ANYTHING that forces the camera to re-focus will totally break the photo and you'll have to start from scratch.-Nine months into use in December, this phone has started to develop a nasty habit of "ghost-pressing" the back button a bunch on its own and completely unprompted, kicking you out of apps and vibrating incessantly all the while. I've apparently been lucky with mine, as this has been an oft-reported issue at least since July. I'm not sure what causes it, but considering I've never dropped this phone or exposed it to any extreme conditions, this can't speak favorably to its build quality.-I don't know if it's the included earbuds or the headphone jack, but it is notoriously difficult to consistently get this phone to pump audio through the earbuds; audio often cuts out, pipes out of the phone speakers at an obnoxious volume, etc.This phone was a steal at the time of purchase, but now I understand why, and I don't totally feel comfortable recommending it for daily use. Look elsewhere unless you just can't find something else with comparable hardware at this price point.

column4: Yes, but not for the NON-tech-savvy
column5: After just three days I am very pleased with the BLU Vivo XL2. But it took a bit to get to this place: out of the box I hated the custom interface -- I agree with those who described it as "heavy". Fortunately I read the Amazon reviewers who recommended replacing it with Nova Launcher, which I did, and then customized it to my liking. Now it is a beauty.The major issue has been using an SD card. I wanted this BLU for my media: audiobooks, podcasts, epubs, video and some music. I have been using Android since 2.3. Never have I had so much trouble working with an SD card. First, there are no instructions (anywhere that I could find) for working with SD cards. This is the first phone I have had with a SIM/SD drawer. There are two slots (of different sizes) in the drawer. Thank goodness another reviewer alerted me to placing the SD card in  SIM slot #1. This may seem dumb, but I was not careful when I popped the drawer out and did not notice the orientation. So when I placed SIM and SD card in the drawer the first time I had the phone display side up. This was a big mistake: when I pushed the drawer in it stuck. Obviously the wrong side, and I had to use tweezers to pry the drawer out, which was not easy. Why was this not in the quick start guide? -- to re-insert the SIM/SD drawer, the phone MUST BE DISPLAY SIDE DOWN.Secondly, since there is no information about how to use the SD card with this model I did what I have done with the Androids I have owned in the last decade or so: I allowed the Android system to format the card to its liking. After formatting, the file explorers in the Android OS or my PC (using USB cable) did not recognize the card -- no trace of it. I do not recall all of the steps I took to fix the problem (I suspected the card was not mounted, a problem I have not had with Android), but before I did I contacted BLU customer service. Other than the lack of information about using an SD card on this machine, the dull-witted BLU CS is the other reason the Vivo XL2 gets 3/5. I explained the problem to them as I have here; their response had nothing to do with this phone. I fixed the issue on my own and now my SD card is recognized and loaded with my content.For whatever reason, BLU loves the paint on this machine (the battery cover). I expected to be wowed, but no: it looks better on the computer photos. I now wish I bought the gold rather than the midnight blue.I cannot tell that the battery charges any faster than the Galaxy S3s and S4 I have used for years, but the description claimed some sort of quick charge. The battery does not seem special.BLU includes a (relatively hard) case in the package, which is nice. I usually prefer more rubbery silicone, but this one allows the phone to slip in and out of the pocket easily Unfortunately, it does not protrude over the screen and protect it. Also, the corners slip off the phone easily. I may prefer the gummy case I had for another phone, which fits better than the one made for it (the slots do not match).During baseball season I watch each of my team's games on my phone. I have not had a chance yet on this one, nor have i watched high quality video yet. But at this point I am quite pleased with the screen. I love the 5.5 inch size.I thought I might like having the power and volume on the same side of the phone, but so far I do not because it is more difficult to pick the phone up without pressing the power button.I read some reviewers comment that BLU phones do not last. Right now I am happy with the Vivo XL2, but I want it to last for years rather than a year.I would recommend it, but I worry about folks who are not tech-savvy using this phone.
Really great phone

column4: Won't Razzle-Dazzle, but a Good, Solid Smartphone and a Great Value
column5: I've had my Vivo XL2 for two months now. So far, everything working about how I expected.My wife and I have had several Blu phones in the past. 2 of the 3 were fantastic (my Studio 6 and my wife's Energy 2), one was a bit of a dog (my Studio 5+5).So far I've been happy with my XL2. It's clearly not a top-of-the-line smartphone, but it's more than enough for what I use it for---phone and texting, taking photo snapshots, watching the occasional Netflix or Amazon Prime video, and Kindle. There's nothing particularly great about it that makes it stand out, but everything is solid---decent looking screen, responsiveness and speed, accurate touch for onscreen interactions. My main gripe with the Blu Studio 5+5 was that the on-screen touch detection was BEYOND AWFUL; I'm happy to report that the Vivo XL2 does not have this problem at all, touch detection is very good.Probably the worst part of the phone is the battery life. It's merely average; I can go a couple of days of minimal use before needing to charge it. So, nothing all that bad, but nothing to brag about either.All in all, this is an incredibly solid smartphone for a very good price, and is easily all the "smartphone" non-gamers would need. It's not the sexiest thing out there, but I've been highly satisfied with my purchase.

column4: BLU VIVO XL 2 vs ZTE ZMAX 2
column5: So this seems like the first real review from someone who actually owns the phone.Just got it in the mail yesterday. This was suppose to be the Gionee P7 Max rebranded by BLU. The back isn't as shiny as Gionee so looks like BLU did a good job recasting it with their logo. This seems a lot heavier than my previous smartphone (ZTE Zmax 2) but I needed an upgrade from my 16gb internal storage and 2gb ram. VIVO XL 2 offers 32gb internal storage and 3gb ram but it definitely doesn't feel any faster than the Zmax 2. In fact, in some cases, it feels like it lags behind Zmax 2 when I only have one or two apps opened. Which I found it to be strange.Even though their width and height are quite similar (VIVO XL 2 being slightly wider), I found the Zmax 2 and its buttons a lot easier to hold and use with one or both hands. For some reason the VIVO XL 2 seems like it's almost jabbing the side of my palm when being held. I don't find it comfortable and the buttons on it are rather slimer than the Zmax 2 and while you would think that might be a plus, taking screenshots (holding lower volume+power button) and volume control is somewhat of an unnecessary hassle.Also the back finish on Zmax 2 really helps you secure having a grip on your phone whereas it's easier for VIVO XL 2 to slip in between your fingers and fall.The login screen that asks for your pattern or password for VIVO XL 2 is awkwardly place towards the top of your screen (whereas Zmax 2 place it at the bottom of your screen) - which makes it difficult to unlock it with just one hand.One good thing about VIVO XL 2 is its 13MP / 8 MP camera. While it's nothing extraordinary, it does seem to take clearer picture than the Zmax 2. The VIVO XL 2 also comes with Android Marshmallow, whereas Zmax 2 is upgradeable to that, it's installed with Lollipop.As for the accessories, all of them are WHITE. Which is a key giveaway BLU was too lazy to source their accessories to match their phone colors (since VIVO XL 2 only comes in blue and gold). It's a USB charger so it does take longer to charge your phone back up in compare to Zmax 2. Package wise, it was a lot nicer than what I expected for a phone in this price range. The phone built is pretty much what you would expect in this price range but from afar, it doesn't look cheap (if you purchased the blue version).BOTTOM LINE: If you're looking for a 32gb internal storage and 3gb of RAM with decent camera on a budget, VIVO XL 2 might be for you. If you already have a phone with 2gb of RAM, that +1gb of RAM isn't going to give you any fairytale endings.
