column4: Hit or miss on it working properly.
column5: Phone worked great for the first six months. Then the front buttons started acting up. The phone would act like the home button was pressed (and sometimes held so that the Google Assistant would be enabled). You wouldn't be able to do anything else on the screen until this glitch stopped. You also couldn't press any of the other buttons on the front. I would have to shut off the screen, wait a moment and then go back to what I was doing on the phone.I contacted Blu, who had me send it in at my expense, and then they "fixed" it (they wouldn't tell me what they did to the phone). Now, two months after that, the phone started exhibiting the same issues again. My wife has the same phone, purchased just a few months after I initially bought this one, and hers is working fine.Outside of this issue, they phone works great. Plenty of storage for apps, music, etc. Great amount of RAM for apps to run and not be sluggish. Speaker volume on pretty much any BLU phone is always low, so wasn't surprised that this phone was the same.

column4: ... bought my Blu VivoXL2 in March and it worked great! Loved the extra memory for the price
column5: I bought my Blu VivoXL2 in March and it worked great! Loved the extra memory for the price. 6 months down the road, my apps started freezing then the battery went crazy from 80% to 30% in a matter of seconds, then it wouldn't charge. I called Blu and I had to send them my cell and pay for the shipping. Luckily I saved my previous cell otherwise I'd be without a phone. I mailed it on a Friday, they received it on the following Wednesday and they shipped it back 2 days later and I received it on Tuesday 7 business days later. Not bad. The phone arrived with no invoice or what they fixed. No email either explaining other than they shipped my cell back to me. I called and was told they changed out the battery. 11 days later again the battery won't charge now. So as I write this review I'm getting ready to call them again. Save your money and buy a Samsung. My Samsung prime is still kicking after a few years. It just didn't have enough memory. Update- so I just called Blu customer service. Told them my cell won't charge or turn on after trying 3 different chargers which included the Blu charger that came with the phone originally. So now they put in a request to replace my cell. They are emailing me a return label so I don't have to pay shipping again, which I appreciate. They will be sending me a new cell not a refurbished one per the csr. So I'm satisfied so far.

Sooo,  This would be my most favorite Blu phone(out of 5) ever, got it on a lightning  deal for 99.00, but.....There is an issue with notification/ringtones not giving a sample sound when you select one.  To test it you have to have someone call or text you.  Blu would not acknowledge this in 3 complaints through amazon so I started a return and received a second phone, same problem, and returned that one.  4th time they said there is a software problem and they are working on it.I have had an issue with my call blocker app not functioning properly.My advise is whenever buying a phone for 100-150 expect some glitches.  For the money I think they are great. My Life XL functions great but it only has 16gb memory.  This phone has a great 32gb and accepted my 64gb sd card no problem  Fantastic.  If I can get this problem fixed, I would keep this phone for a long time.  If this problem does not get fixed, I will return this one, and go back to the life XL.I also previously complained on the lock screen  and lack of an app button to show all your apps of a previous model. That was not answered, but have found with this model it is their "carefree" launcher.  I switched to Nova launcher and am happy with that.

column4: Definitely a good phone for only $150
column5: I've had this phone about a week and am pretty pleased so far.LIKES:--comes with Marshmallow--camera seems pretty good, includes native editing software--processing speed is fast--start screen is super handyDISLIKES:--battery life is not as long as I had hoped, still have to charge once a day--size is almost too big for my little hands (but I guess this would be a 'like' to some people)--the default launcher lacks the app drawer, I had to find a third party launcher to install
Works excellent.

UPDATE: I had to return the original because it kept freezing and refusing to turn on and randomly restarting.  Now I have the replacement and it's doing the same thing!!!!!  I think there may some issue with the firmware when a smartwatch is connected over Bluetooth and a WiFi network is connected.  If you disable any of those things the phone works fine.  Beware those of you who intend to connect a smartwatch.Nobody needs to spend $400-$800 on a smartphone any more.  This is a NO COMPROMISE $150 phone.  Show me someone who needs more features and power than this phone has and I will show you a darn liar.  Not only does it have a terrific 5.5" size screen with a curvature to the gorilla glass 3, but it has an IR blaster to control your home A/V system, great 4G and Wifi radios with crystal clear audio on both ends, and the battery lasts and lasts! Looks and feels like an expensive phone too.  Amazing value and it's American made too?  What more could you possibly ask for.  Great stuff BLU keep up the good work.  If Nougat gets rolled out on it, I might just soil myself.

I recently bought the Blu R1 HD Amazon promo phone and was blown away by the functionality.  It was a big step up from what I had been using (tracfone models) and I planned on keeping it for a good while.  Well, I managed to break the camera lens and figured I'd order another- guess what, Amazon won't sell you two of the promo phones.  I looked at the various Blu offerings and settled on the Vivo XL2.  Maybe I'm just easy to please, but I love this thing.  32 GB, great camera, and what I think is the sweet spot on phone size- not too small, not too big.  Great display, and they throw in a case. 2 screen protectors (one already on) and a good quality set of earbuds.  I took the advice of another reviewer and put a 128 GB sd card in and it works fine.  I guess the only complaint is the "dual" sim card aspect.  It's not a dual if you want to use an sd card, it will only accept one.

This is my 3rd Blu phone.  My previous daily driver was the Blu XL  which was fine except 16G/2G was just not enough.  At this price for a 32G/3G phone I couldn't resist upgrading. I don't even think I will ever need to use the SD card slot as 32G is ample space for my needs. One very impressive thing I must say is that my reception using this phone is greatly improved at work where nobody gets service - With this phone I have decent service from ATT. It's like this phone is more receptive than my other phones? My phone rang all day long which for me at work has never happened - I used to just get notifications of missed calls and voicemails on my drive home.

column4: Good phone for the price! Message Access Profile is NON-EXISTENT on this device.
column5: I really like the feel of the phone, and the speed at which it handles application (thanks to the 3GB of RAM). In order to use a SD card, you must put it in the SIM 1 slot, and the SIM card will sit in the SIM 2 slot.  Another annoyance is that the phone does not have the Message Access Profile (MAP) that is needed when syncing with my car (Ford Flex w/ Sync 3). Phone will sync, but messages will not connect to car, due to the missing MAP file. My prior BLU Studio phone had this feature and it worked flawlessly.

The old version was cheap plastic and broke easily.  This model was definitely stronger.  What I didn't like is that it says the speed of charging is improved and I found it incredibly slow.  If not using the Blu branded charger, it literally didn't fully charge when left plugged in overnight.  With the Blu charger it took 3 hours.  Hugely disappointed considering that was a big selling point.  There is also some software that is not removable that kept coming up as malware.  You couldn't even disable it.  I'm big on security and this scared me a bit.  Finally it was quite a bit slower than the old model in my experience.  I will be returning today.

UPDATED REVIEW:After seven months of having this phone, the battery ended bulding up and completely breaking the phone.The battery life was not the best ever since I brought it, but after about four months of use it started to go straight downhill in its performance eventhought I always used the charger that came with it.Long story short: Ended up with a bulged up battery that cannot be replaced because it is non-removable and thus, with a useless phone.I deeply regret this purchase.OLD REVIEW:I purchased this item a little more than a month ago. Before it, I used to own the original Vivo XL (item that I absolutely loved, its performance almost flawless during the whole year I owned it -just had a little problem with the app Snapchat- But it had a great value for its price) that I sadly ended up breaking in an accident.While looking for replacement I found out, to my huge excitement that the VIVO XL2 had been released just a moth before, and to the same price than its predecessor. I was torn, trying to decide which one to acquire but, considering the great item the VIVO XL proved to be and after checking out this phone's specs, I did not hesitate and chose this one, expecting an upgrade from my previous one.However, this cellphone proved me terribly wrong. It fails on many aspects the original did not.•Its screen in incredibly sensitive, to the extent that it reacts even the touch of the earphone's wire -it's not a nice thing to be listening to music or watching a video and having it closed or changed by your own earphones-.•Both cameras are absolutely bad, they claim them to be of 8 and 13MP just like in the original, and yet their performance is by far worst even if made to snaps pics in their supposed best quality. The primary one keeps blurring out the photos and, when it does not they seem granulated and rough, lacking color and brightness. The secondary one only takes decent pictures when outside under direct sunlight, if the photo is snapped indoors -where lighting is usually a bit lesser- they turn out blurred and undefined. Problems I did NOT have with the VIVO XL which photographies were clear and vivid (a little too sharp while in the camera screen, maybe, but nothing too dramatic).•The apps continuously freeze and crash.•But, by far, the BATTERY LIFE is absolutely the worst this Smartphone has to offer compared to the original one. While I could have my VIVO XL running continuously -with a normal app use- for almost two days straight after a single charge, this one does not last more than maybe 12 hours, when I'm being careful not to open too many apps. Such is the bad performance it has in this department that many times, the minute after -literally- the battery level reaches 15% the counter will go down incredibly fast and the cellphone will shut down. Such thing only happened to me with a very bad performing Samsung I used to have some years ago, because yes, you guessed it, this did NOT happen to my original VIVO XL which I many times kept "alive" for hours with less than 8% because it had an OUTSTANDING performance. This is not an exaggeration.Also, less points to this model because the battery is not removable, which leaves you unable to forcefully turn it off if it eventually freezes -thing that I'm sure will happen to me at some point soon due to this device poor performance-.So, in resume, if you are planning to buy this item I HIGHLY recommend you reconsider it and purchase the original VIVO XL instead. That Smartphone is by far much better than this supposed upgrade.I ended up regretting greatly having bought this one alternatively, because I ended up getting me a very disappointing downgrade. I have nothing good to say about his cellphone because it practically did not improve its performance compared to the previous one.

column4: Too Hot to Handle...Can I Send it Back?
column5: I received the phone yesterday, and SO WANT TO RETURN IT!Within moments of use the battery heats up to high intensity. Maybe a nice rubberized case would prevent that from happening, so perhaps not a deal breaker. On the other hand, the battery drainage is crazy. I used it a few moments last night after a full charge, then put it to sleep. Now there is about 30% of battery life left. I used my Honor 5x for a much more extended amount of time last night, then put it to rest, too. At this moment, it still has an 80% charge.I thought 3g RAM and 32g Memory would mean a faster device. Not so. My Honor (2g Ram/16g Memory) matches every inch of speed.The sound on calls is very "tinny". Ringtone and notification alerts are muted so that you can not hear them if you're more than 10 or 20 feet away from the phone. Very little sound comes out of the device.Ultimately, if you want a device that makes your hands uncomfortable, has no battery life, isn't any speedier than lower rank smartphones and has no volume, this is the phone for you.AMAZON! PEOPLE! SOMEBODY!!!! Please advise me on the return policy for this phone. I don't want it. I don't like it. And I SINCERELY want to return it without penalties.

Also I've had a terrible time getting it to carry through on calls in my car using bluetooth.  But a call to their help center suggested a hard reset and that fixed the problem.  I'm only giving for stars because the battery life is not the greatest and I don't know why they advertise it as a fast charge.  To get to full charge has taken an average of 3 hours!!  Over all for the price it's a nice phone and it comes with a case, head phones and a charger. column4: The reason I’m giving a bad rating is their customer service

My family currently has a Blu R1 HD and Life XL phones that connect flawlessly to both vehicles. The reason I’m giving a bad rating is their customer service. I contacted their support team and this is their response” Thank you for contacting. Blu Products. We are happy to help you! We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. Keep in mind that our devices utilize standard Bluetooth Profiles, and some manufacturers require more extensive or specific Bluetooth profiles that may not be compatible with your device.  Please refer to the Manufacturer of the Bluetooth product for assistance with compatibility inquiries.”
Runs smooth and has a clear screen.  I'll never buy an expensive ass Retail store phone again.

column4: Nice phone, camera needs improvement, but the overall package is well worth the money
column5: Overall it's a great phone, especially for the price. Before ordering, I was concerned about the screen resolution, but once it arrived and I started using it, I should say that paying more for a phone with a greater screen pixel count would be waste of money (at least for myself, as would not notice any difference). The screen resolution of this phone is just fine. Brightness is ok also, with no difficulty to read the screen when outdoors. The build quality of the phone looks good. Battery life is better than all the previous phones I had. I always charge it overnight, but it could go on for two days without charging (my previous Nexus 5 - the one from LG - wouldn't last until the evening). Sound quality is also better than expected. Speed is not great, but is more than satisfactory for everyday use. Also nice is the fact that it comes out of the box with a screen protector already fitted (plus a spare one in the box) and a nice protective silicone case. The only things I miss is an NFC reader. And the camera could be improved (focus is poor if you are shooting in low light conditions or close to the object). All the rest is just fine!

Received my Vivo XL2 earlier today.  Even though I just received it, I do have a few comments.  The unit itself is well done.  It looks much better than in the pictures.  One thing I've noticed with this phone and with my Vivo 4G LTE is that the screen stays cleaner than any other phone I've owned.  Presently I have a Nexus 6 and as good as it is, I'm constantly wiping the screen.  With the Vivo's, the screens repel smudges and prints extremely well.  The back isn't a fingerpring magnet either.  Yes, it gets prints on it but not near as bad as other phones that I've had.  Because of this and that I like the appearance so well, I've decided not to use the case on it.  I also ran the Vivo XL2 and Nexus 6 side by side and went through some apps (Google news, Radar Express, Weather) and in each case the speed was identical with both.On a negative note, I wish Blu would be specific in their information as to Sim size needed.  I couldn't find anything confirming that Sim 1 is a Nano Sim.  So I ordered a Nano to Micro Sadapter which I didn't need.  Sim 1 is a Nano sim card.Update 1-28-17  I needed to the permission requests before the ringtones would be made available.  I initially tapped deny but when I re-did it and tapped ok it gave me the build in ringtones.I did change the launcher to Google Now.  I mention that because with either launcher there are no ring tones except one in settings.  Can someone Confirm this for me and if this is the case, what is a good app to use for ringtones ??  Thanks
Very good phone

column4: Good phone with a good price.
column5: This replaced my Blu Studio 5 phone. It is a bit more advanced and taking me some time to become more familiar with it. The extra 0.5" inch screen is very nice. This is an Amazon sponsored product, so there are some apps that can't be removed, and I am getting too old to worry about monkeying around with the settings to allow getting rid of them. I have no problem recommending this phone. I use this with PureTalk USA which uses the AT&T network. I had a little problem figuring out placing the SIM and SSID cards in the phone, but I figured it out fairly fast.

column4: Pros Fast - With specs like what are listed what else do you expect
column5: ProsFast - With specs like what are listed what else do you expect? Phone does most of everything without missing a beatLook - Phone looks nice, I got the Gold and it looks very decent and not at all cheap lookingPrice - Got this on Amazon lightning deal for 99.99 and it's a steal for this price. Even for the full price it's not a bad deal for what you getSpecs - Very decent specs for what you pay for.  32 GB of storage space should be standard on most phones these days.ConsBeing nitpicky I'll name a few cons in the interest of being balance but these aren't major complaints I have but just complaints I can imagine people having.Screen - Not the resolution, the fact that it has a dark bezel around the perimeter of the screen inside the bezel so the screen doesn't extend right to the end of the bezel like with other higher end devices. Not sure if this is a design flaw or purposely made choice to keep price downCamera - Ok taking regular pics but don't expect ANYTHING like what you would get in higher end phones but then again for 99.99 I did not expect Iphone quality.UI Overlay - Blu should stick with making cheap phones and leave the UI building for higher end manufacturers like Samsung and others. Look at how long Samsung and HTC took before people took to their UI systems.  It's not a bad UI it's just not needed.Overall the phone is a real treat and I guess time will tell the full story on how long it lasts if it's treated properly.  For the time being though it seems to work very well.
This was a huge waste. I opened the box, inserted my sim did the set up. That's as far as I made it. The phone wouldn't read my sim card. Nothing I did helped.
Device is being return, the MEID is still active, but it's a brand new device...it's look really nice.
the phone works fine, but if that is gorilla class I'll lick a coal miners boot.

column4: wtf is with this sim card / sd card HIDDEN ...
column5: wtf is with this sim card / sd card HIDDEN slot draw with a special magic key for.... but yall dont got a finger print scanner, but you got the old floppy disk drive on a damn "new vivo xl 2" the cheap plastic piece for the hidden sim card draw broke, now what...had it 2 days. metro pc didnt know how to open the hidden sim card so he gave me a free HTC phone.....avoid this phone wait for the vivo xl 3, bet they add finger print scanner

column4: No case, no parts... Be VERY VERY careful.
column5: The first time I dropped this phone (which was the first day I owned it) the screen completely shattered. Of course that is my fault, but I had an iPhone 5 for two years before this and never broke the screen even though I dropped it many times. The Gorilla Glass 3 on this Vivo XL2 did not seem to help at all. Maybe the glass is just too wide to be so thin. Combine this with the fact that you cannot find a case for this phone yet (the one that comes with it is thin and useless) and you can't buy parts (except from the manufacturer who charges too much to justify repair)... and you would be wise to look elsewhere. I actually liked the phone, but with no available protective cases and no cost effective way to repair it, I wish I had bought something else.

column4: Yeah it works great. Granted I am bummed my other one (Vivo ...
column5: Yeah it works great.  Granted I am bummed my other one (Vivo XL) didn't last for more than a year... the power jack broke kinda which took out the cel antenna somehow. Outside of that it still works great, I use it as a tablet/MP3 Player now.  But anyway... this model Vivo XL2 works very well. Pretty much identical to the orig XL except it went back to the Micro USB jack instead of the USB-C jack like the XL has. One of the two SIM slots doubles as a micro-sd slot if you want extra storage. (Guess they had a location issue on the motherboard, which I find odd since they didn't have that problem with the XL)  They moved the camera to the top middle, added more on-board storage, and a little faster processor, and a IR blaster for using your phone as a TV remote.  The camera is a little better, and the sound quality is about the same as the XL model. The interface changed a bit too.. once I figured out how to turn off BLU's or Android's funky smart screen then it worked perfect for me. I like it.. I just hope it lasts for years and years..like five at least.  I never had a phone break down before five years before. Maybe because before I found the BLU phone I was dedicated to Samsung user.  But then Samsung started coming out with yukkie phones after the S4.  BLU makes some nice phones. They are getting there..Stylish and functional.  Especially the dual sim feature.  Worth every penny.

column4: She absolutely loves this phone she keeps the Gal 5 as a back up This phone has all of the bells and whistles she wanted and mor
column5: I purchased this phone for my daughter in college. I replaced her Gal 5 with it. She absolutely loves this phone she keeps the Gal 5 as a back up This phone has all of the bells and whistles she wanted and more The 32 GB HD was a terrific plus it has an elegant appearance and high quality feel she is a really smart girl and her phone had to match her intelligence }:o)

Great phone for the money! Corning Gorilla glass, curved screen! This phone has a whopping powerhouse 1.4GHZ quad core processor, 3 gig of ram, and a 32 gig warehouse of storage for all your photos and memories! Weighing in at one pound, the phone is a little heavier than I'd like, but not really something that bothers me enough to remove a star. The Vivo XL2 gives you the quality, speed, and reliability of a Samsung Galaxy, for less than half the price! Comes pre-installed with Android 6.0 Marshmallow! Comes with screen protector and protective case.

column4: Awesome phone. Was sceptical when ordering
column5: Awesome phone. Was sceptical when ordering, but after using it for like 3 months I felt really pleased. Agreed it may not be the best phone ever, but then no mobile phone can be labelled- best phone ever! Many want a mobile that responds fast, and I tell you the Blu vivo XL 2 does just that, thanks to the 3gig RAM. The picture is sharp and the camera's got some nice features. Though some space out of the 32gig internal memory have been taken by applications, but there's still enough storage available for files-including videos, so if you are the type like me, that uses both SIM slots then you might not be bothered about an external SD card. One SIM slot is MICRO and the other is NANO, however you can only use one SIM slot if you intend on inserting an external SD card. Battery strength is 3150mAh, would have better if it were 5000mAh to help sustain the much needed apps on the phone. Comes with nice useful apps that helps you get updated. The head phone sound is clear, doesn't echo. Video resolution is crystal clear, nice to watch 🏠 of Cards😉. All in all it's a phone I'll recommend any day. A trial will convince you!

column4: Stop searching and just buy it! ;)
column5: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!! this phone. It is everything I wanted, and more. I was hesitant at first, with it not being a "name brand" phone. I previously had a Droid turbo 2 with Verizon, but after having a couple of financial hardships I had to switch to a pay as you go plan. I didn't want to lose the luxury of my phone but I couldn't afford a high end Motorola. After reading all of the specs of this phone I decided I would take a chance, and I was not let down! I'm not one to write reviews but I believed that with this purchase I had to. This phone is AMAZING! the screen quality is excellent.  I love the smart gestures it reminds me of my Droid or a high end Samsung phone. It has a 32 gig internal memory and if that isn't enough then you can add a SD card for extra space, unlike my Droid or a newer Samsung phone. The function to connect to my TV is very handy. I haven't had a television remote in about two years, and I couldn't download an app to connect to it because I can't connect my tv to WiFi. I tried it believing whole heartily that it wouldn't work, and was extatic when it did. These are just a few of the many features that I love about this phone, and I fully believe it is just as high end as any Motorola or Samsung phone and for only a fourth of the cost. At this price YOU CAN NOT BEAT IT! stop searching and just purchase it! ;)

column4: No verbal text message read out available when Bluetooth is connected in car.
column5: Greetings.This is a good phone however, the feature I looked forward to is not available.  The phone will not send text messages to be read  via the connection to the Bluetooth in my car.  This is a safety feature that I used frequently in my line of work.  If there is an upgrade to add this feature that would make this phone a GREAT device. If not, is there a different phone manufactured by BLU that has this capability?

I upgraded from a Blu Advance 5.0 to this model and I couldn't be more happy. The 32 gb is more than enough storage but I added another 32 gb just in case I need it. Comes with a screen protector already on it and an extra protector for when you need to change it. It also comes with a rubber back case. I can do without all of the extra apps and wish manufacturers would stop forcing this stuff on us consumers. There is no way to uninstall the ones I don't want and some of them you can't even disable them. Other then that this is a great phone, I would highly recommend this phone as a great alternative to those expensive phones

column4: Got this on Black Friday, so far so good :)
column5: Got this on Black Friday, so far so good :)  It's way more phone than my old one and came with the screen protector, case, earphones and charger. Compatible with Cricket, can live stream several hours at a time to Facebook and never drops.  Picture quality is nice so overall, I am pretty happy so far. ***Used Swagbuck Amazon credits so only paid $43 in real money so totally worth the price :)

column4: Really nice cell phone, get the 32gb phone memory!
column5: Beautiful phone, gold metal case. Looks, feels and works like top cell phones. Love the camera and all the fancy pro extra's. Learned the hard way on my first smart phone (had 8gb built in memory), this Blu has 32gb built in memory, I love it!! Plus I took it to Tracfone for cell service. Top grade cell phone with great cell service for peanuts!!! Really happy and satisfied!

column4: Little to no problems. Great phone!
column5: I actually loved the phone a lot. Great camera that satisfied me a lot with all the different options which me is great. The charging was fast, but what comes with fast charging also Comes with fast battery loss. The resolution of the phone is also great, but only a bit of lag, but not hard to deal with. I had very little problems. I wish I kept it safe if I didn't get it soaking wet. I loved the phone overall and will be buying it again. I love Vivo and for me being a teenager, I do use the phone very often And I'm surprised it didn't break down on me with my amount of use on it. The only thing I didn't like about it was that it does get very slippery because it is sleek and the steps to get to the home screen as well as watching videos using the phone's video viewing app which does show poorly. I do highly recommend though!

column4: ... is my 3rd BLU phone and so far so good. I bought this to replace the R1HD and ...
column5: This is my 3rd BLU phone and so far so good.  I bought this to replace the R1HD and so far it is better on all levels as it should be.  The battery has lasted 24 hours with moderate use and still has over 50% left.  The OS doesn't exhibit any lag (yet) switching or running apps.  It does contain a compass sensor that allows you to use some navigation or star apps.  As with my experience with BLU phones, the camera is borderline terrible in all but bright sunlight.  The lock screen overlay is unusual but you can disable it if you choose.  The case it comes with is pretty lightweight and definitely won't protect it well with any falls onto hard surfaces.  I hope they make a more substantial case as an accessory.  The included screen protector also scratches very easily, but at least it comes with one.Bottom line, this is a solid midrange phone with a poor camera that doesn't break the bank.  The phones are cheap enough that you don't mind upgrading when next year's model comes out.
Good phone it just wont send text messages

column4: Very good but room for improvement
column5: It's a good phone, hasn't let me down yet after about 3 months of owning it. Has some neat features and tons of space. The battery lasts fairly long on heavy usage. Takes nice photos and apps open very quickly. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is just some personal views preferences like the back doesn't come off which could be a problem down the road if I ever need to fix my phone. There's no app folder. All apps are on your screen. You can create folders to put your apps into but that'll remain on your screen so I can't hide any apps. Lastly this isn't a fault of the phone but this phone is very new and not really a major company so if you want a new phone case or screen protector you'll be very limited.Tldr: good phone overall. Neat features. Some personal preferences it does not fill for me. This is worth your money though.

I had the Blu Vivo XL before buying this phone, and I absolutely LOVED everything about it. It was by far the best phone I've ever purchased, but because the charging port stopped working and the battery started acting up I NEEDED to order a new phone, and decided on the next line up.I love Blu's service. I love everything about this company.But, not even a week after I bought this phone the charging port for THIS phone started acting up. No joke. The entire reason I even bought this phone is because of charging port problems, and now I'm having them again??I know it's not the charger, it's the phone. And I don't know what to do. I'm just extremely disappointed.

There are a couple of issues with the phone that keep me from loving it. First and most obvious is the grip of the phone or the lack thereof. It is slippery...terribly slippery. Yes, it includes a hideous semi-clear silicone case but case options are minimal at best. Secondly the screen responsiveness could be better. I tend to miss type more on this phone than any other phone I've had and I often hit the wrong numbers when dialing. Another gripe is the lack of support for 5ghz wifi connection. Why? Just why? Other than that it's like every other Android with similar specs. Pretty good camera, fast enough, and fairly reliable.

My advice to all, please don't buy this phone. I purchased this phone right when it came out and have been using it for about 5 months now. The only thing that it has going for it is that it looks good. It's slow, apps launch without me touching them, the screen resolution is terrible, and for some reason the flashlight turns on randomly even though the screen is locked. I previously used a Samsung Galaxy s6 edge and bought this because it was cheap. I now know why the flagship phones are so expensive, you really do get what you pay for.

column4: Best Budget smart phone with 3gb ram and 32gb storage
column5: Wow, pretty sweet phone for about $100-150.  I don't have prime and got the phone in 7 days and of course it was package nicely from shipping and the GOLD box was also nice looking but it looks ultra taggy with the gold look on the entire box.  I really like the big battery on it.  The screen is great too at 720p so this will draw on battery less.  SD card and LTE support for TMobile a big plus.  So far so good but the Blu UI is a bit backwards but Google Now Launcher to the rescue.1 whole day of it and i'm pretty impressed by it.

column4: the Blu phones charging ports give out easily, that has been our experience anyway
column5: So far my son loves his phone, has had it for just over 3 months.  Historically, the Blu phones charging ports give out easily, that has been our experience anyway.  Both his prior blue phones had the usb C so there is no wrong way to plug the charger into the phone, hoping this one lasts.

column4: Large Print & Type For Those Who Need to See!
column5: I absolutely L-O-V-E this phone. The screen is big enough for me to see & read & my fat little fingers can use the keyboard easily when sending messages. This is exactly what I needed. You've got all my votes, BLU! I will definitely look at a BLU when I need a new cell again.

column4: Absolutely in love with this phone!
column5: I love this phone so much! I got it as an early birthday present, and so far it's worked amazingly! Games run smoothly and there's plenty of space on it. I can't recommend this phone enough. The headphones it comes with are awesome. Luckily it can hold both the SD and SIM card in the same place for easy access. The cameras are awesome as well. I'm an extremely happy customer, great job blu!! <3

I bought this phone month end July 2017...started using it August 10th. Bought it because of glowing reviews seen on Amazon.When I got it, I loved it! The phone was just like the people said. Loved the design, the graphics, storage space, though I hated the front camera (my blu life 8 was better).....Until last week (the week of September month end), I realise the phone will not charge. I decided to try charging it while off, it charged. After a couple days, the phone went blank and totally responsive. Felt it vibrate when I said 'ok google'...but otherwise dead phone.After googling my problem, I realised there were maaaannnnyyy reviews of persons having the same problem with the phone! Contacted the manufacturer as advised. The only option, return the phone to them for them to repair and return to me.  Told me the phone would need servicing! I live outside the US, it costs $$$ to send it back from where I am and I was also supposed to secure shipping to have it return to me! The length of time this would take equates to forever. I don't see why I should stand these costs only after having a 'brand new' phone for only a month and some weeks! No, sah! Blu could care less!This is my second Blu phone, the first lasted three years but after this, I'm done! Buy at your own risk.

I've had this phone for almost two months. Overall, it seems like it is good quality for the price.This phone has several good points. It has a lot of memory storage for the price which I really like. I like keeping language learning apps on mny phone and always had a problem running out of memory on old phones. That has not been the case with this phone. I like the appearance of the phone and the screen is pretty clear. It also came with a free frosted case which was a nice bonus.The cons to this phone are the very quiet speakers and a tendency to freeze up. The freezing hasn't been a huge issue so far, and I'm not sure whether it's caused by bugs in the apps I use or the phone itself. However, the speakers are the quietest I've had on any phone.

Didn't look exactly as advertised.... but close enough. Everything included, as advertised. Surprisingly good speed for a device at this price. This phone is seriously outperforming its price tag! The only reason it's 4stars... is simply the physical appearance.

This phone is everything they say it is. It's every bit as good as a 500 dollar phone. That being said, I had issues with it at first being laggy and choppy. Then after a day or two, I got an alert for an android update. Once I got that installed, it worked really great! The camera is a little grainy in low light, but it takes great pictures. Great sound, the bluetooth and the apps work smoothly for streaming audio in my car. All around, it's a pretty good deal for the money.

column4: Bought it because I've been happy with other BLU products and this one has more ...
column5: Bought it because I've been happy with other BLU products and this one has more memory and RAM than the previous ones, so I thought what the heck. Well right off the bat I didn't like the launcher that it was loaded with. I turned that setting off after I finally found it. It is a beautiful phone but what's the point if you have to have a cover... and on this phone you HAVE to have a cover. Because of the shape and surface of it, it's like trying to hold onto a wet bar of soap. Lastly after using it for a couple months with no issues I notice some of my files just seem to disappear (pictures most noticeably) from time to time. I would not recommend this phone although I could understand why some people really like it, it's just not for me.Update 7.28.17..liking it less and less, in fact of the  three BLU phones I have (this one being the most exspesive of the three) I rarely use this one. Problems with Bluetooth compatibility. I rent cars regularly and most of the time my Vivo will pair with any car but while it allows me to stream audio, the phone function does not connect so, I can't make and receive calls through the vehicle system. I've tried several fixes but always the same results. I can not recommend this phone and I should have sold it when it was a newer modwl but my conscience wouldn't allow me to inflict it on some poor unsuspecting soul.

column4: Great but why sacrifice the color
column5: Great phone got all the specs a moderate techy needs. Speaking as someone who went from the xl to this one though; the xl2 color sharpness is noticably weaker. I think it's a result of the much thicker Gorilla Glass which is too bad for me cause I don't need this Glass. The xl screen never scratched, even when in a pocket with my keys. It was also shatter resistant enough to go from car seat to concrete a handful of times with no damage so this thicker Glass seems unnecessary at least for my purposes. The colors by no means dull just a little weaker than the xl.
Hard earned money well spent.will buy one for my God daughter before year end.

column4: Does Everything a $600 Phone Does at 1/4 the Price!
column5: Great phone!  Does everything a $600 top brand at 1/4 the cost. I'd never heard of BLU before but I recommend them now.  These guys are gonna be the new "Big BLU!"

column4: So far so good. I switched from an iPhone 5c to this
column5: So far so good. I switched from an iPhone 5c to this. Previously only had 8GB of storage, now I have more than I know what to do with. I'm not tech savvy, it does what I need and I'm satisfied.

This is a very nice phone and it looks very premium! This phone was too good to be true but once I received it I was in shock of how fast it is! It comes with the phone, wall adapter, back case covering, charger cable (usb) manuals, screen protector, a connector piece from Mars, and headphones!PROS:Perfect 5.5" phoneAndroid marshmallow 6.0Quick chargesPlays most high end games wellDoesn't break easy from a dropCons: I'm trying to find one...

column4: Good stats, nice phone, but RMA and customer service nightmare
column5: This one looked really promising.  I'd purchased it as an upgrade for the Energy X Plus, which I absolutely loved.  However within one week of opening the box, the screen started going crazy.  I tried performing soft resets, hard resets, and factory reboots, even removing my SDCard from it.  None of this worked.  I contacted BLU's support team several times in a row and kept getting canned responses back (several days later) with instructions on performing a hard reset--which I already explained (in excruciating detail in the third time) that I had done.I was finally told that I might be eligible for an RMA.  The instructions for the RMA would require me sending the phone back to them at my expense, and that basically I would have to go without a phone for several weeks while they decided if it was a hardware issue or not--and that the replacement (or my original phone) would be sent back at my expense.  Part of my work involves doing RMAs routinely, and it's standard procedure with every vendor I deal with to send the replacement along with a waybill to send the original back, then to bill the customer for the difference if the issue appears to be customer-caused or the original unit is not received.  So this is shifting the cost of doing business off to the consumer instead of the company.  I'm glad of the price cut on these versus other companies, and I totally get there are trade-offs, but this one's just a bit steep for me.  I wouldn't mind paying a bit more if it meant having a phone that I can actually use and customer service interested in making sure that I can use what I buy from them.Look, I've had good success with Blu over the past few years, and I'm not meaning to dog them over this.  I've been a huge fan since the dual-sim capabilities let me carry both my work and personal phones in one package, which is a huge convenience.  But my experiences with this phone have really left a bad taste in my mouth after seeing what happens when the phone doesn't work, and I just don't think this is one that they'll recover from easily.

column4: Upon opening the package everything looks good considering the price
column5: Upon opening the package everything looks good considering the price. Head phones look cheap. Camera quality is good. When I turned the phone on, during setup I realized the screen display (how best should I discribe it) had lines across the bottom of the screen. I was most disappointed and will be returning the phone.

column4: One of the best blu phones, xl2 very good!!
column5: Excellent phone, I love it work excellent is fast the camera work great have space 32gb it's a phone you can buy without problems. this is my third blu and blu is my brand. my fisrt blu  was blu studio 5.0ce , my second was blu advance 5.5 HD and now my blu vivo XL2.

column4: I give this as a gift and they love it! Nothing to envy to other branded phones
column5: I give this as a gift and they love it! Nothing to envy to other branded phones. Nice cellphone and easy to use if you are patience and treat it nicely.

column4: Its a great phone. But when I received it
column5: Not to put the phone down. Its a great phone. But when I received it, it had been used. The plug and cord were different colors and it was packed like it had just been thrown in a box and taped up. I bought two the other I gave to my pastor he loves it. I guess if it had been new as advertised, I would have enjoyed it more. I am more upset fact it was a used phone.

I love this phone. It has a great camera, battery lasts better than other phones and it was easy to set up on Straight Talk. Works great & I would recommend to anyone looking for a new unlocked phone.

column4: Thank you for providing a good quality phone for a fraction of the cost
column5: I bought this phone as a replacement for a friend's daughter for Christmas. It's exactly what she wanted. Thank you for providing a good quality phone for a fraction of the cost.

I absolutely love this phone. I had a blu phone prior to this one and OMG such a huge difference. It's smooth and sleek. Im so happy with everything the phone has to offer. I've had it for about a month now and there's still a lot im learning about the phone.

column4: easy to hold and its very comfortable in hand
column5: The design of this phone is lovely,easy to hold and its very comfortable in hand.The camera quality is great and the user interface smooth and I like how there's no bloatware apps on it i would definitely recommend purchasing this phone !
My wife loves this phone,  She is 100% happy with it, Just don't buy the Tan IVSO BLU Vivo XL 2 Case, THE CASE IS NO GOOD.

I pickup the XL2 on the lighting deal and glad I did. I thought the VIvo line was a better line of phone for BLU? I owned BLU phones in the past and this on I like the least. The battery(3150 non removable) is the biggest concern as you can barely make it through the day.I believe the battery is under sized for this model. Can get hot if your on a call for a while,I mainly use for calls.The "start" UI  can be trouble some when you password protect your phone. The 3GB ram  vs 2GB ram that is in the LifeMax not much different? Which I was using prior to XL2 .The 13MP camera takes nice pictures. The XL2 comes with headset, lightweight protective case and screen protector. The speaker can sound muffled. I like the slim and lightweight design. Internal memory 32 Gb and was able to add 64 GB Sd card.  All phones have their good and bad points. Overall not a bad phone.

column4: BLU phone sent me an iPod
column5: Got the phone and sim cards were not giving me service. Thought that At&t was the problem but after 2 one hour sessions in store and a hour and a half long session over the phone they tried everything and concluded that the problem was with the phone and not them. Called the BLU phone customer service and they had me do a master reset but that didn't work either. The camera for some reason provided potato level quality on snap chat. Started to get slow after a couple days. It made a decent iPod for what its worth but not a phone that I was able to use. Returned the phone asap.

column4: Great size and options for this phone
column5: Has worked well. I love the size and the ease of use. Great phone for the money

column4: I inserted her T-Mobile sim carefully she has been very happy since. Video playback is satisfactory coming from someone ...
column5: I did a ton of research and decided to buy this as a gift for my mom. I inserted her T-Mobile sim carefully she has been very happy since. Video playback is satisfactory coming from someone who has owned galaxy's AMOLED screens for the past 4years

Love this phone. Just wish it had a slot for the SD card to have more storage. Very fast when you on the internet. Take wonderful pictures. A little heavier then the last model of this phone. Does thing like an $700 phone at the grate low price.

Nice phone for the money.Has all the bands needed for t-mobile.build quality is nice, has a little weight to it.calls are clear, external speaker has decent volume ,considering it is located on the back of the phone.definite upgrade from the original Vivo XL which I have as well.
Awesome cheap phone. Got this last week. Haven't had any issues with it. Charges up super fast. Camera is excellent

column4: You must send your phone to them for warranty work!
column5: Do not buy a phone from BLU.  Because, as they told me, they are a manufacturer and not a supplier, the first thing they will ask you to do is a hard reset on your phone.  You will lose everything.  All your contacts, apps, everything.  It will be the same as when you bought it.  Then, if that doesn't work you can start the warranty process.  You fill out a form and send it back, then you call them back, then you send your phone to them.  Yes, you read that part right.  Then,  in 10 to 15 BUSINESS DAYS they will let you know if they are going to replace it.  During this time and the transit time, you do not have a phone.  The only good thing I can say about them is they answer the phone quickly, but they are off-shore.

I've had to send in my previous phone twice to Blu and the customer service is great! My phone was not able to be fixed and they sent a better, newer phone. They go above anything I've dealt with in years. My fiance drove off with his older phone on top of the car recently. It made it three miles before it fell off. We didn't know until later. It was dark and raining so we couldn't find it. Two days later he found his Blu phone wet, battery out and the phone in several pieces. The screen was cracked. He put it together after drying and it worked for a two months more! What a work horse for a phone. We are staying with Blu for both those reasons. You can't beat the price for the options on this phone.

column4: BUYER BEWARE - BLU Products has a VERY, VERY bad warranty policy that you should consider before buying their products.
column5: BUYERS BEWARE!!!!!!Any "physical damage" to the phone - including superficial chips and scratches that do to affect product performance - WILL VOID THE WARRANTY.I purchased this phone on March 1st, 2017.  The phone worked well, and I like that it came with a free case and screen protector.  Up until, the phone fell out of my pocket and hit the ground.  The case fell off and the plastic edge of the phone suffered a minor chip.  The screen was not damaged and the phone worked perfectly fine afterward, so I decided to keep the phone and buy a better case for it.Fast forward to September 2017 - seven months after the chip occurred.  The phone starts acting weird - registering "ghost touches" - backing out of applications while I am using them.  So I emailed BLU customer support and they sent me instructions on how to do a hard reset.  I followed their instructions and performed the hard reset but the problem continued.  Next I called BLU customer support.  When I spoke to a representative, I was asked "did the phone suffer and water damage or physical damage?"  I explained what had happened, the phone dropped, the case fell off, and the phone got a small chip in its case...  The CS rep told me that if the phone was subjected to "any physical damage" that the warranty was void.  I reassured them that the screen problem had nothing to do with the chip in the case - that the phone work perfectly for seven moths after the chip.  The CS rep instructed me to send a picture of the phone and a copy of my receipt so they could take a look.I took two photos of the phone - the first was a close up showing that the damage was just in the plastic case and the second was an overall shot showing how insignificant the chip was and what good condition the phone was in (see attached photos).  Needless to say, when I called back BLU Products denied my warranty claim citing "physical damage" to the phone.So I'm out $150 because BLU's case failed to protect the phone and I wasn't smart enough to return it to Amazon the minute it got chipped. (Again the case was defective.).So, please don't make the mistake I did.  Consider that if your phone get's so much as a scratch on it, BLU Products can deny any warranty claim regardless of if the scratch or chip has anything to do with the damage.Too bad.  I really liked the phone.  But the warranty policy is terrible.

column4: An okay phone that's not really worth buying at the end of the day...
column5: The phone is an "OK" product overall. The build of the phone is nice where it feels good in the hand and not too heavy to handle or difficult to engage comfortably. The screen resolution is probably one of the most pleasing offerings for a phone in the below $200 price range. Now to the bad parts. Although the phone has some positives it's the software and apps that really anchors down the score for me. When I first updated the software it functioned normally without much issue in the first day but after the second day everything collapsed pretty quickly. First, whenever I opened up an app it would take long to buffer and sometimes it would freeze and cancel. Other times, the apps would work for a good 15 mins and then it would slow down incredibly such as gaming apps for example. There were times when I would try to close an app like LinkedIN for example and the master 'back' button on the bottom of the touch screen would take 3 times until it finally backs out; that shouldn't happen. Speaker quality was okay, the sound didn't project loud enough for me and it was on one side of the phone which lacked the surround effect you would expect. Last, I would have issues receiving calls where it would redirect them to my voicemail without ringing my phone. And on top of that, I couldn't clearly hear the person when speaking to them which is like a basic essential for any phone. So overall, the phone is okay for the price but as they say you get what you pay for. Just look for other brands like Huawei, Xiaomi, and Alcatel which are known to have good reviews.

This is the same resolution as the iPhone which came out in 2010 (7 years ago). You will really see this in games and media viewing and it will be a constant reminder that you own a sub par phone.4) The screen will scratch with your fingernail, get a protector immediately.What I do like about BLU phones is that they are lighter than most phones, both physically and software wise, although there will be some miscommunication in settings due to grammatical errors and poor word choice. It charges fast, the os is clean, the buttons off screen are a blessing, and generous amount of memory keep it running fast for a very long time.In essence, it gets the job done, it just doesn't do it well. And for the price, you really can't expect it to.

column4: Test Your Phone Fully/Siri Cant Heat Me...
column5: When i received this item it was in perfect shape with no scratches or defects; to the naked eye at least. After about a week, i realized that Siri couldn't hear me unless connected to headphone/bluetooth device. Thought this could be a software issue, because the iOS for the X had just come out and I didn't drop the phone or get it wet. All that being said, i still gave the benefit of the doubt to the seller for running all the necessary test to be "certified refurbished" . Then last week i took Apple up on its 29$ battery exchange program and told them about the Siri problem i was having and they took a look at it. They ran some test and said my front mic (aka Siris ear) wasn't working and that it was a hardware issue and that they often can go out with regular use. This isn't a huge problem for me as i dont use Siri that much (especially now), but i know a lot of customers who would and be very upset by this. Just be sure to fully test your phone, and be sure not to let the window pass for returns/exchanges.  2.5 Stars.

column4: When I received my phone I was super excited. I kept thinking how cool it was ...
column5: When I received my phone I was super excited. I kept thinking how cool it was that I bought this normally so expensive phone for such a good price. I soon found out this phone is terrible: The screen freezes, the screen's sensitivity is awful (sometimes it opens apps I haven't even touched or types on its own) and the screen is so hit-or-miss that I had to get rid of my password entirely because there were several instances where I could not get into my phone. I would press the 1 button and it would type 0 or 7 and would put random numbers in until it actually disabled itself. Having had this experience, I now understand why more people don't buy refurbished cell phones. While it seems really cool to have the latest technology at a discounted price, I think full price is worth having a fully functioning device. While I am keeping the phone (because I am unable to return it!!) , I am very unsatisfied and I will not be buying a refurbished phone (especially not from this seller) again.If I could give this a 0-star rating I definitely would. I am so frustrated with this phone and cannot believe I spent so much money on it.

column4: Didn't even make it a year.
column5: The good:  Phone looks excellent.The bad (well, annoying, but not bad bad) Battery was completely dead but seems to be taking a charge.  Won't be activating the phone (more on that) but I'm gonna let it charge and update this later.  (Update...phone activated on Straight Talk and seems to be working properly).The ugly: Update.  Dead after 9 months.  Battery is dead and nothing will make it go. Tried all the online 'iphone not responding stuff'.  Tried the hard reboot, reset, etc.  Cleaned the charging port (it isn't dirty and doesn't look damaged).  So, looks like we'll roll the dice on a battery swap and pray it's not money down the drain.  After all the IOS bugs and headaches, I'm ready to go back to Android unlocked.

column4: I am very satisfied of the improvements of the iphone 6
column5: Belinda42 The iphone 6 is a long lasting, good quality, and durable phone. The phone comes in many varietys of colors, and the Apple company is frequently ugrading the style of the phone.Concerns:One of my concerns with the iphone itself is that it is very skinny and can cause the iphone to crack easily if not taken care of properly. This product is like an ipad but you can text and call on it.Positives:The iphone is an apropriate size that can fit in your hand, and it also has a large screen. The camera on the phone can take good quality pictures and videos, leaving you with a fantastic picture. Also the iphone has an excellent battery life, and it can last up to one to two days without needing to be charged. I can use my phone often throughout the day lasting me all day. I prefer people who are older than 10 should have an iphone. The iphone 6 is a great phone. I use this product everyday with no problems. It is a high qualitly phone with many beautys that makes my life a lot easier. If I were you, I would go buy the iphone 6 asap.

The Galaxy S7 was wonderful while it worked. Great screen, great battery life, decent software, amazing camera, MicroSD slot. Everything you'd want in a phone. The waterproof claim is also impressive, although I was never bold enough to test it. I put the phone in a rugged UAG case and babied it, hoping to get a few years out of it.However, six months after purchasing, the screen suddenly began to die. Half the screen is now dead despite there being no physical damage or trauma to the phone. I babied this thing, seriously. No drops, no scratches, no cracks, nothing. I suspect a manufacture defect with the screen's connector or something. First, I called Samsung. They refuse to repair international versions of the Galaxy S7, even if you offer to pay for the repair. Then, I called the seller about getting this repaired or RMA'd. They didn't respond. I contacted Amazon and they also contacted the seller. No response. I called the seller, no one picked up the phone and the voice mail box was full. Spend the extra cash and get this from a different seller. I'm out a lot of money for a faulty phone.For more information about this defect google "vertical lines in screen," - it seems fairly common and most people have a similar story.

Then tried to return the money on an Amazon gift card! Nope! 2 weeks later and countless calls finally have returned complete. 100% fake phone! Pls do your research on what an actual s7 can do and then compare to this. Its missing ALOT!

column4: Nice at first, then problems, now dead at 10 months
column5: I bought this from seller "The Wireless Circle". I am a US AT&T customer in a 4G LTE market.First off, the phone came with the UK electrical outlet Fast Charger with an outlet adapter to US. This wasn't a problem to me other than bulkiness just not what I expected.Another thing, in the central midwest, I had a hard time being anywhere where I received good signal strength 4G LTE. I even called AT&T about it and attempted a new SIM card (thinking that possibly the card unlocked certain frequency bands). I ordinarily wouldn't care about this, except the battery statistics constantly say that the cell standby was using most of the battery.This weekend is when the real problem started. I was using the phone and when I looked back after a few seconds, the screen was frozen. I tried to end software but everything was unresponsive--the touch screen and the buttons. I tried restarting the phone: the power button produced no response. With older models, I would remove the battery at this point in time. In the last 2 days, I have tried charging, performing various button press combinations, and even taking the device to an AT&T authorized retailer. This phone is dead. 10 months at about $550.I would not recommend buying this phone unless you have a solid plan for returns/repairs/warranties.

Absolutely in love with my Samsung galaxy s7. The phone lasts for a long time compared to most phones and it fits comfortably on one hand. The SD card allows the phone to hold more space than the 32GB that is included in the phone. Also this phone is pretty slim unlike my former Samsung Note 4.

An awesome phone and considering the age and the price it definitely holds up to any modern smartphone, not surprising because it's only two and a half years old. But it's upgradeable to the current Android software and comes with all the features you would expect. Love the water resistance especially coming from a phone that had no water resistance. My only complaint is sometimes switching to Bluetooth to phone and headphones causes a glitch where the sound well only come out of the phone speaker and not the main speaker, however this only happens rarely and usually a restart will fix it. Overall I love this phone probably be best phone I've ever had, would definitely recommend if you need a good smartphone and want to have a little cheaper price:)

column4: RESTARTS ON ITS OWN...CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE BATTERY DIES.
column5: After six months of careful usage and no drops or scratches on this phone, I agreed to a Security Update in October of this year. BAD IDEA. As soon as this happened, my phone began to restart. CONTINUOUSLY. OVER NIGHT. I went online to research and most users of the S7 suggest to do a factory reset. I emailed amazon.com and they directed me to a Samsung Customer Service website. I inquired about the damage and they gave me a step by step run through a factory reset. I made sure the battery was full. It was restarting so often that I could not even back up any of my data. I LOST EVERYTHING. I did the reset and it was okay for a few minutes. Just enough time to let me sign into my google account and proceed. It kept restarting. Overnight. I decided to do it one last time so I charged it. Glad I checked back on it after an hour because the device was HOT. I could not even hold it long enough to unplug the charger from the wall. I am just out of luck with this phone. I don't even know what to do or how to get it replaced. I understand the no warranty but what happens to customers like me who took damn good care of their expensive phone and only after a security patch update that the phone started to act up and never returning?!Has anyone had this issue? How was it resolved?

column4: Great purchase! I originally had a U
column5: Great purchase! I originally had a U.S. Samsung Galaxy S7 (SM-G930AZDAATT) on the AT&T network and when I got it wet, my cell phone insurance plan directed me to go ahead and buy a new phone.  Since the retail versions sold at AT&T stores would have run me $695 + tax, I decided to look at the international versions because they typically are a bit cheaper than the full retail versions in the states. Glad I went with this one.  After doing some research (which can be a pain to do) I found out that this SM-G930F cover almost all the same bands/radio frequencies that the U.S. AT&T uses.  I get great coverage for data, and about the same or slightly worse coverage for voice, but since I rely on data mostly, I am not complaining.  The phone actually seems to be a bit faster than my original S7 from AT&T, because it does not come loaded with as much bloatware (theres still some from Samsung, but not nearly as much as the U.S. carrier versions of the phone).  Also, the setup and activation was very easy.  It comes with the same nano-Sim card and micro-SD card tray (both fit on the tray and it slides into a port on the top of the phone) and after you pop in your carrier's nano-Sim card, it recognizes the nano-Sim and automatically connects.  Overall, I am happy with the purchase.  If I run into hardware or connectivity issues, I will post back here with an update. If there are no updates from me within the next month, then assume everything works well on the U.S. AT&T network (metro ATL location) using this international Galaxy S7.

I will be starting off with good points of the phone,-3000 mAh battery: This is great due to most phones nowadays not having such large batteries, this makes the phone last very long throughout the day even through some pretty heavy use. And with the addition of quick charging, makes it lightning fast to charge and get moving.-IP68: This means the phone is dust and water resistant, so if the phone drops in water, there are no worries and it should work perfect after (has always for me)-SD card slot: Bringing this back was a great idea, now you can extend the space by adding a mini-SD card again.-12 MP f/1.7 back camera: This is honestly the best camera I've used on a smartphone in a while, as well as having a great auto-focus feature makes it even betterOnto the downsides,-Bloatware: Comes with a lot of bloatware apps that come preinstalled, pretty annoying but not too big of a problem-Removal of IR Blaster: Not many people did use this, but it was a very nice feature to use for TV's and what not.-Glass back and front, with metal rounded sides: This makes the phone extremely slippery and can be dropped very easily (Best to get a case or skin to make it less slippery)Overall, it is a great phone with great specs. Fast in everything I've done from gaming to watching videos to recording. Have had no issues so far with it. Amazing phone, Samsung.

column4: I used a stock version rom and the battery and tweaks are great. If you can afford to buy outright
column5: This is the way to go for those that do not want bloat from carriers. Got this in two days, rooted, and put on a custom rom right away. This unlocked for carriers and the bootloader is not locked either. I used a stock version rom and the battery and tweaks are great. If you can afford to buy outright, not a payment plan, this is what you should do. The only issue I see is the lack of us warranty, but I am not worried. The phone itself is great. I had a s6  that was driving me crazy as it had lag and design features they took out when they went from the s5 to the s6. The S7 is definitely worth the upgrade as I did not feel the need to get the s8. With the ability to put newer software at my discretion, I will keep the phone for years to come. Mobile International is who I got the phone from and it arrived quickly.The phone has been very responsive, great on battery so far and easy to navigate through items with software updates. The camera works well and my wifi connections have been much better than with the S6 (another reason I switched). The additional memory slot is a welcome return and the camera recognizes when inserted to automatically save pictures there.  This is nice so that it leaves room on the internal memory.I have not tested its ability to resist water (and do not plan it), but overall worth the cost of the phone. I will revise if I have any issues in the future.

Above and beyond expectations. I came from the Sony Xperia Z5 Compact, which I loved until their version of Android took a Marshmallow-sized dump and massively glitched out, becoming unusable. Sony's "XPERIA™ Support" was of absolutely no help in this matter. Before Xperia, I owned the Sony Z3 Compact and the Samsung Galaxy S2. Definitely glad I switched back to Samsung! The grass is NOT greener on the other side, believe me!I'll take Samsung's 12MP over Sony's 23MP any day. Far superior in the areas of auto-focus, low-light, and manual parameters. The Sony Z5 Compact can record 4K video as well, but not without tons of initial lag and post lag (storage, encapsulation). The Samsung S7 is relatively quick with 4K on the initial and reasonable with the post (when you finish recording).And the phone volume is LOUD. Usable, in fact. Sony's Z5 Compact was disappointingly quiet.Great phone.

column4: To my great surprise, Samsung made my dream phone
column5: This being my upgrade from a Sony Xperia Advance (a mid-range smartphone from a few years ago, which was also waterproof), it's perhaps not surprising that I am thoroughly impressed by this device. I had looked at the S6 last year, but it wasn't enough to make me want to buy, in particular given the lack of waterproofing, the lack of expandable storage, and the good but not mind-blowing camera. Samsung has made the S7 everything I had been dreaming of but didn't see in the S6, and I just couldn't say no. On paper, the S7 is my perfect phone.And it turns out it's my perfect phone in practice too.The camera, which was the main selling point for me, lives up to the claims. I have been getting great indoor (and outdoor) shots of my 5-year old in action. With my old phone, that was completely impossible since it would take at least 10 seconds to open the camera app and focus. With the S7, I can go from picking up the locked phone to capturing a perfectly focused image in 3 seconds (I caught my son in mid-air as he jumped off a ramp on his scooter). And the colors are almost always very close to what I perceive with my eye, even in some unusual lighting (like midnight in the arctic in spring, or mixed fluorescent light/sunlight in my living room).The screen is gorgeous as everyone knows. Its resolution is riDONKulous.The phone is a good size for me (good balance between being comfortable in the hand, fitting in the pocket, and having a usefully sized screen). I got a slim Spigen Rugged Armor case for it, which makes me feel much more confident in gripping it (in a way, the phone itself is too thin and smooth and glass), and gives the phone a slightly different but still cool look.Of course, it's expensive. But you're really getting a phone, a palm-top computer (which is as fast as any smartphone out there and therefore fast enough to make any Android 3D game or other app run smoothly), an e-reader, and a better-than-point-and-shoot camera all in one.I definitely recommend this device.

column4: BEAUTIFUL phone.  12 hours in and everything is working great!
column5: Just received my new phone, upgrading from a broken Galaxy S5.  So far, I love it...First, the color...  My previous Galaxy was a lovely gold color, but I started to wonder whether I was tired of the gold, and whether I should buy the S7 in a different color.  In the end however, I chose gold again.  The great news is that the S7's gold color is a bit more of a bronze color than a true gold, and LOOKS GREAT!  The previous S5 gold was nice, the S7's gold is much nicer!I paired it with an Acmebox gel clear gold cover (only $5.64) on Amazon.  The cover gives full protection (including a lip around the front edges).  Best of all, the clear cover with a hint of gold in it somehow enhances the already fantastic S7 gold cover.  The result is a VERY EXPENSIVE looking phone, for only another $5.64 in investment.The display looks very clear and crisp.  I've always loved Samsung displays, but this definitely improves on the already great S5 display.The phone takes a "Nano" SIM card, vs. the "Micro" SIM card in my S5.  This means that you can't just plug your existing SIM card into the new phone.  You may have to wait a few days for your carrier to mail you a new one (or visit a store).  However a lot of Micro SIM cards are actually Nano SIM cards that are Micro sized, and you can just punch the extra micro plastic away to break it down to a Nano size.  In my case, I was intially disappointed when I realized that my SIM card wouldn't fit, until I remembered that TMobile had shipped me a new SIM card that I'd kept but never activated.  Sure enough, the new SIM card was a Nano SIM but with the extra perforated plastic to bring it up to Micro size.  Therefore I was able to have TMobile activate it over the phone, and my phone is now usable.I had a bit of a hard time copying my photos and contacts over to the new phone.  Thankfully Android knows that this is an important issue for new phone users, and the start-up software tries multiple ways to get everything over.  In my case, the NFC approach didn't work at all, and the data cable approach (which comes with your phone - thanks guys!) only pulled over apps.  THe back-up to Google also didn't work (maybe it just took too long).  So I went old-school and just backed everything (photos and contacts) up to the SD card, inserted the old SD card into the new phone, and everything transferred fine.Another thing that initially disappointed me was that the phone did not come pre-loaded with a swipe-style keyboard (there was an option for it in the Settings - but it was greyed out).  However at least 2 free swipe-style keyboards were available from the app. store.  I downloaded both the Google as well as the Swiftkey keyboard.  Of the 2, I prefer the Google keyboard (It feels the most like the one on my S5).  Issue solved!One other odd thing to be aware of... Since the back is no longer removable, the tray for the SD and SIM card is on the top of the phone, and can only be opened by an odd-pin-like device that is included with the phone.  I guess its not a big deal since I seldom need to access the SD card.  But it seems odd that I won't be able to open the tray unless I have the pin on me...Overall, I'm very pleased with my new phone.  ...No regrets (and glad I waited for the S7 vs. getting the no-SD-card S6).
Shipping was quick, I had it at the very next day of placing the order. Everything was fine. I've been using the phone for 4 months now and there has been any problem.
